title: Wholesale Coordinator
description:
Location: Remote 

Reports To: Wholesale Directors

Department: Wholesale



About Chamelo

Chamelo is a celebrity-backed brand growing triple digits. We bootstrapped our way to 8-figures and are about to close a VC round with the goal to accelerate growth toward an IPO.

At Chamelo, we’re engineering a new era of smart eyewear by combining state-of-the-art technology with cutting-edge style. Our mission goes beyond creating dynamic and stylish glasses—we’re pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in a traditionally static industry.

Our eyewear isn’t just functional—it’s bold, customizable, and effortlessly cool. Backed by iconic figures like Shaquille O’Neal and Bad Bunny, Chamelo is on pace for rapid expansion, offering an exciting opportunity to be part of our growth story.



About the Role

We are hiring two highly organized and detail-driven Wholesale Coordinators to support the rapid expansion of Chamelo’s global B2B and retail partnerships.

This role is critical in managing the end-to-end wholesale order lifecycle — from account onboarding and order processing to fulfillment coordination, inventory allocation, and post-delivery support. You will serve as the operational backbone of the wholesale team, ensuring a seamless experience for retail partners while maintaining internal accuracy and efficiency.

The ideal candidates are proactive, data-driven, and thrive in a fast-paced environment where precision, communication, and follow-through are essential.



Key Responsibilities

Wholesale Order Management

Process and manage wholesale purchase orders from receipt to fulfillment.

Validate pricing, SKUs, quantities, payment terms, and shipping requirements.

Coordinate order entry, acknowledgments, and invoice accuracy.

Track order status and provide timely updates to wholesale partners and internal teams.

Account & Partner Support

Assist with onboarding new wholesale accounts, including documentation and system setup.

Serve as a primary point of contact for order-related inquiries and operational requests.

Maintain strong, professional communication with retail buyers and distributors.

Support key accounts to ensure smooth reorders and ongoing partnership growth.

Inventory Allocation & Fulfillment Coordination

Work closely with supply chain and warehouse/3PL partners to allocate inventory for wholesale orders.

Monitor stock availability and communicate potential shortages or delays proactively.

Coordinate shipment scheduling and routing based on partner requirements and delivery windows.

Ensure compliance with retailer routing guides and packaging standards.

Data Management & Reporting

Maintain accurate wholesale data across ERP/CRM/order management systems.

Track wholesale KPIs such as order accuracy, fulfillment timelines, sell-through support, and backorder rates.

Assist in preparing weekly and monthly wholesale performance reports.

Help maintain up-to-date account records, price lists, and line sheets.

Cross-Team Collaboration

Partner with Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, and Customer Experience to ensure seamless execution.

Support product launches, seasonal buys, and promotional campaigns from an operational perspective.

Assist with trade shows, market appointments, and sample coordination as needed.

Contribute to building and improving scalable wholesale SOPs and workflows.



Qualifications

Strong organizational and time management skills with exceptional attention to detail.

Experience in wholesale, B2B sales support, order management, or supply chain coordination, preferably in ecommerce or consumer goods.

Proficiency with ERP/CRM systems, inventory tools, and Google Workspace/Microsoft Office.

Ability to manage multiple accounts and orders simultaneously in a deadline-driven environment.

Clear and professional written and verbal communication.

Solution-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Experience working with global retail partners, distributors, or 3PLs is a strong advantage.



What We Offer

Competitive above-market salary.

Paid time off and paid holidays.

13th month pay.

Regular performance bonus.

Annual salary bonus/increases based on performance.

Remote-friendly work environment.

Fun and collaborative culture with team contests.



Application Process

Please send your resume and answers to the following questions to 

Subject Line: “Wholesale Operator!”

Application Questions

If you could be one famous entrepreneur (alive or dead), who would you be and why?

One paragraph (5 sentences max) on any relevant experience you have.

Your favorite productivity hack.

What are your key strengths?

What are your weaknesses?

Your desired number of weekly hours & desired start date.

Your availability next week for a quick chat.

Equal Opportunity

Chamelo is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

High performers are placed into pods and scaled.

• 3 role-play responses (text only)

• If approved, you receive a paid starter batch

• Performance on that batch determines long-term placement



Q1 — Have you set appointments before?

If yes, what type of offers and how many per day?



Q2 — Are you comfortable following a script exactly without improvising?



Q3 — On a scale of 1–10, how comfortable are you speaking to business owners on the phone?



Q4 — What would cause you to miss a scheduled shift or stop showing up?



Q5 — Are you looking for short-term work or a long-term performance-based role?



Q6— When a lead is unqualified but insists on booking, what do you do?



No role-play calls required.



Screening is written only. First calls are paid.

title: APPOINTMENT SETTER — PERFORMANCE ROLE (NO SALES)
description:
APPOINTMENT SETTER — PERFORMANCE ROLE (NO SALES)



This is not a general VA role.

This is a pure appointment-setting position inside a high-volume sales system.



If you cannot hit daily numbers without excuses, do not apply.



?



???? ROLE SUMMARY (READ CAREFULLY)



You will:

 • Call and follow up with warm + cold leads

 • Make 150 outbound calls per day (minimum)

 • Qualify prospects using a fixed script

 • Book qualified appointments onto a calendar

 • Update Google Sheets with zero errors



You will NOT:

 • Close sales

 • Handle payments

 • Answer customer support questions

 • Modify scripts or freelance messaging

 • Skip call volume



This role is numbers-based only.



?



???? PERFORMANCE METRICS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



You are evaluated on:

 • Appointments TAKEN (not just booked)

 • Show-up rate

 • Sheet accuracy

 • Daily call volume (150/day)



To remain active:

 • 150 calls/day

 • Minimum 6–8 qualified appointments/day

 • No missed shifts

 • No skipped reporting



High performers are placed into pods and scaled.

Low performers are removed quickly.



?



???? TRIAL PROCESS (WRITTEN ONLY)



There are no live role-play calls.



Trial includes:

 1. Short written qualification

 2. 3 written role-play responses (text only)

 3. If approved ? paid starter batch

 4. Performance on that batch determines long-term placement



First calls are paid.



?



?? IMPORTANT FIT WARNING



This role requires:

 • Comfort speaking with business owners

 • Following scripts exactly

 • Repetition

 • Rejection

 • High call volume daily



If you:

 • Get nervous on calls

 • Need motivation

 • Dislike structure

 • Prefer flexibility



???? Do not apply.



?



???? QUALIFICATION QUESTIONS (ANSWER ALL)



Q1 — Have you set appointments before?

What type of offers? How many calls per day? How many appointments/day?



Q2 — Can you follow a script exactly without improvising?

Yes or No (explain briefly).



Q3 — On a scale of 1–10, how comfortable are you speaking to business owners on the phone?

(Anything under 8 = not a fit.)



Q4 — What would cause you to miss a scheduled shift or stop showing up?

Be honest. Vague answers are auto-rejected.



Q5 — Are you looking for short-term work or a long-term performance-based role?

Explain.



Q6 — If a lead is unqualified but insists on booking, what do you do?

(There is a correct answer.)



?



???? FINAL NOTE



This role exists to support a January revenue sprint.



We are building fast, scaling hard, and removing friction.



Only apply if:

 • You can hit 150 calls/day

 • You can book 6–8 qualified appointments/day

 • You can show up every scheduled shift

 • You want to earn your seat through performance



Quality over excuses. Output over opinions.

title: Junior QA Engineer (API, WebSocket, SDK, Monitoring & Load Testing)
description:
Industry: Financial Technology 

 

About Us: 

We are a dynamic fintech company delivering innovative market data management solutions. As our team expands, we are seeking a talented Junior QA Engineer to ensure the accuracy, reliability, and performance of our systems. 

 

Position Overview: 

This role is ideal for someone early in their career who wants to grow into a high-impact QA, reliability, or systems-focused engineer. You will go beyond surface-level validation, verifying not only technical correctness but also business meaning, data accuracy, and real-world usage scenarios across APIs, WebSocket services, SDKs, monitoring, and load testing. 



Junior-level but highly curious and detail-oriented 

Enjoys learning how systems and business logic fit together 

Thinks like a user, tester, and business stakeholder 

Takes ownership of quality and follows issues end-to-end 

Not satisfied with surface-level validation 



Qualifications: 

Proficiency in Chinese (speaking and understanding) 

Basic understanding of HTTP / REST APIs 

Familiarity with JSON 

Experience with Postman, curl, or similar tools 

Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail 

Ability to reason about data meaning, not just formatting 

Willingness to learn complex business logic and system behavior 

Clear written communication for both technical and business-related issues 



Bonus Skills: 

Experience with API or WebSocket load-testing tools (k6, JMeter, Locust,  

Artillery Understanding of performance concepts (latency, throughput, concurrency) 



Very Important to Have: 

Willingness to deeply learn business requirements, data definitions, and rules 

Ability to validate responses from a business perspective 

Comfort with validating calculations, derived fields, and cross-field consistency 

Curious mindset that asks “Does this make sense?” not just “Did it return 200?” 

Exposure to WebSocket testing 

Basic scripting (Python, JavaScript, or similar) 

Familiarity with monitoring or logging tools 

Understanding of authentication (JWT, API keys, tokens) 

Interest in backend systems, data quality, and reliability 



Why Join Us: 

Work on real-world backend and data-driven systems 

Learn how business rules translate into APIs and data 

Hands-on exposure to monitoring and performance testing 

Clear growth path into Senior QA, Automation, Data Quality, or SRE roles

title: CapCut Video Editor
description:
Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using CapCut.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:



Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style. 90% will be talking head with and without overlays:



Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.





Talking head with overlays and supporting clips - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.





B-roll content - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.





You will be working hand in hand with me on extremely viral social media pages and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met on a consistent basis!



Requirements:

- Attention to detail

- STRONG English

- BASIC Spanish

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

- Availability to work 3-4h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

- Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

- PH or similar time zone



$300/month + bonuses for 3-4h a day MAX and potential for full time work in the future with a salary increase. During this time frame you're expected to edit at least 10-15 basic talking head videos a day.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (20 minutes max)



Below is a Google drive with the original files you will need to edit this video:



Google drive: 





Please complete the following steps:

- Download the original video file under the ‘Recreate assignment ORIGINAL Video + ASSETS’ folder and upload into CapCut

- Remove any pauses and dead space during the talking.

- Remove any repeated phrases, take the best take.

- Ensure the pacing of the video flows well.

- Add photos from the ‘Recreate assignment ORIGINAL Video + ASSETS’ folder at the beginning of the video when I mention them and point at the screen. Make sure the photos pop-up where I’m pointing on camera.

- DO NOT add any captions.

- Add the following Text Overlay: “carribean mom beauty secrets” from 0:00-0:07. Add the text centered, above my head, in a wrapped white background with black letters. Same text style you see in this video. Make sure all text is within one line.

- Upload fully edited video into the ‘Upload completed assignment HERE’ and name the file ‘[Your Name] + [Time it took].’



Excited to have you onboard :)!

title: Landing Page Developer (No-code page builder) – eCommerce (Remote)
description:
Build high-converting landing pages. Work fast. Make an impact.



We are an 8+ year old eCommerce group running multiple online brands, and we’re looking for an experienced Landing Page Developer to join our team.



Your core job will be simple and clear:



To build landing pages with landing page builder apps that support our marketing funnels, and help maintain the online store through updates, optimizations, and fixes when required.



This role is designed for someone who already knows how to build landing pages, understands conversion-focused design, and wants a stable long-term position with a growing eCommerce business.





What we offer

- Salary: $600 USD per month

- Employment Type: Part-time, 20 hours per week (4 hours per day) 

- Location: Remote

- Leave: 10 days of paid time off and 5 days of sick leave annually



Who This Role Is For

This job is perfect for you if:

- You enjoy building landing pages 

- You already have real experience creating pages for eCommerce brands

- You can take a design and bring it to life without hand-holding

- You work fast and take pride in your work

- You want a long-term role instead of random freelance gigs



We are not looking for beginners.



We want someone who can join the team and start making an impact quickly.



Process training is provided





What You’ll Be Doing

As our Landing Page Developer, you will:

- Build and maintain landing pages from provided designs and mockups, including advertorials, listicles, sales pages, promotional pages, and product-focused landing pages.

- Accurately duplicate and implement designs from swipe files and creative references, ensuring pixel-perfect execution.

- Ensure all pages are fully responsive and functional across desktop, tablet, and mobile screen sizes.

- Work closely with the marketing and creative teams to launch new campaigns, iterate on pages, and implement updates quickly.





Required Experience & Skills

- Real experience building landing pages for eCommerce brands.

- Hands-on experience with page builders, preferably Gempages (or similar platforms like Replo, Shogun, PageFly, Unbounce, or Webflow).

- Ability to turn mockups into finished pages quickly and accurately, working from Figma files, briefs, and swipe references.

- Strong grasp of responsive design, ensuring pages look and perform perfectly on desktop, tablet, and mobile.

- High attention to detail and layout fundamentals, including typography, spacing, and visual structure.

- Self-sufficient and fast-working, able to deliver quality pages with minimal supervision.

- Comfortable working remotely with Slack and ClickUp.





Growth Opportunity



This role is built for the long term.

If you perform well, you will:

- Transition to full-time

- Become a core member of our marketing team

- Take ownership of landing page production

- Grow alongside a fast-moving team

- Unlock quarterly performance bonuses



We are looking for someone experienced, reliable, and fast.



If you’re a landing page developer who enjoys building high-quality pages and wants a stable long-term role with an eCommerce company, this is for you.





How to Apply

To be considered, please include:

- Example portfolio of landing pages you’ve built

- Platforms you have experience with (Gempages, Replo, etc.)

- Your current availability

- Short description of your experience with eCommerce pages

- Please submit your responses using this form


 



Important:

Applications without real landing page examples will not be reviewed.

title: [Remote] Virtual Receptionist VA | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: BookKeeper
description:
We are a U.S.-based real estate and corporate housing company. We manage multiple rental properties across the United States and process thousands of financial transactions every month. Start your
 or message with this exact sentence:

Real Estate Bookkeeping is my specialty. We are hiring a part-time Senior Bookkeeper who has direct experience working with U.S. real estate clients. 

This is a long-term role. For consideration of this role, send a message to kwakupakom at gmail dot com or message me on IG: kwaykuu. We are looking for someone who can take ownership of the books and ensure our financial records are accurate, organized, and audit-ready. Also, include the answer to this in the question, what is forty-seven plus 10. This is not a beginner role. You must already be familiar with U.S. real estate bookkeeping.



Your Responsibilities

You will be responsible for maintaining the books for our U.S. real estate operations.



This includes:

 • Managing QuickBooks Online

 • Categorizing transactions correctly

 • Bank and credit card reconciliations

 • Accounts payable and accounts receivable

 • Recording rent, expenses, and reimbursements

 • Tracking property-level income and expenses

 • Preparing monthly reports (Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet)

 • Identifying and fixing discrepancies

 • Supporting monthly close

We process thousands of transactions per month. You must be comfortable working at scale.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (DO NOT APPLY WITHOUT THIS)

You must have ALL of the following:

 • At least 3 years of bookkeeping experience with U.S. clients

 • Direct experience bookkeeping for U.S. real estate companies

 • Strong QuickBooks Online experience

 • Strong reconciliation skills

 • Experience handling high transaction volume

If you do not have U.S. real estate bookkeeping experience, do not apply.

title: GoHighLevel Virtual Assistant (AI Specialist)
description:
Job Title: GoHighLevel Virtual Assistant (AI Specialist)



Job Overview:

We are seeking a proactive and technically skilled Business Assistant / Virtual Assistant to support our two growing businesses: a merchant services company and a reputation management system (Review Wizard). The ideal candidate will have strong GoHighLevel expertise, AI/automation experience, and the ability to manage both administrative and technical tasks.  management, task organization, and operational support

title: WordPress Developer
description:
WordPress Developer (Project-Based – Referral Platform | Clio Integration | 75-85 Hours)



Project-Based | Approx. 80 Hours | Potential for Ongoing Work



We are a fast-growing, referral-driven estate planning law firm operating across 23 states. The majority of our clients come through financial advisors and professional referral partners.



We are building out a referral-based WordPress platform that allows our agents to:

 • Track their referred clients

 • See status updates

 • View referral fee payouts

 • Receive automated notifications when clients hire



This is a defined ~89hour project. If it goes well, this can turn into ongoing development work across multiple projects.





Project Overview



We need an experienced WordPress developer to help implement functionality on a referral portal connected to:

 • WordPress

 • Clio / Clio Grow (CRM)

 • Possibly Zapier or API connections

 • SMS notification system



This is NOT just a basic website build. We need someone comfortable with:

 • Custom post types

 • Secure agent logins

 • Dashboard-style UI

 • CRM integrations

 • Webhooks / APIs

 • Automation logic



?



Features We Need Built



1. Agent Status Dropdown (Client Tracking)



We need a dropdown menu visible to each referring agent that shows client status updates.



Statuses include:

 • Consult Scheduled by Agent

 • Cancelled – Agent Follow Up

 • No Show – Agent Follow Up

 • Second Meeting Scheduled

 • Wants to Think About It – Agent Follow Up

 • Hired

 • Did Not Hire

 • Hired and Paid in Full

 • Agent Paid



Important:

We are exploring whether this dropdown can sync directly with Clio / Clio Grow so we don’t duplicate data entry. If possible, we’d prefer it to pull status from Clio automatically.



If not possible, we will need:

 • A structured internal update system

 • Staff-only editing access

 • Agent view-only dashboard



?



2. Agent Referral Fee Dashboard



Each agent should be able to log in and see:

 • Individual client referral fees

 • Payment status

 • Cumulative referral fees by year

 • Year-to-date totals (important for 1099 reporting)



This needs to:

 • Be secure (agent sees only their data)

 • Display cleanly in dashboard format

 • Allow filtering by year



Bonus if export to CSV is easy.



?



3. Automated Notification When Client Hires



When a client is marked as “Hired” in Clio:



The referring agent should automatically receive:

 • A TEXT message (ideal)

 • Or
 as backup



Example message:

“???? Congratulations! Your client has hired the law firm. Your referral fee is on the way.”



We prefer SMS delivery (Twilio or similar integration).



?



Ideal Candidate



You:

 • Have strong WordPress backend experience

 • Understand CRM integrations (Clio experience is a PLUS)

 • Can build secure role-based dashboards

 • Know how to work with APIs, webhooks, Zapier, or custom middleware

 • Think strategically, not just tactically

 • Communicate clearly

 • Work efficiently and respect timelines



?



Tech Stack (Current + Potential)

 • WordPress

 • Clio / Clio Grow

 • Zapier

 • Twilio (for SMS)

 • Possibly Stripe integrations later



?



Scope

 • Approx. 60 hours

 • Clear feature list

 • Defined deliverables

 • Structured milestone payments

 • Potential for long-term relationship



We are building multiple digital platforms and prefer to find a long-term development partner.



?



To Apply



Please include:

 1. Examples of WordPress dashboard or portal builds

 2. Any CRM integration experience

 3. API / webhook experience

 4. Estimated timeline to complete a project like this

 5. Your hourly rate



Put the word “REFERRAL PRO” at the top of your application so we know you read the full post.



?



If you are someone who likes building systems that drive revenue and automate business processes, this could turn into ongoing work.



We value reliability, clean builds, and proactive thinking.



Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: Join braag! Organized, Driven, and Ready to Grow in Sales?

braag is seeking a highly organized, proactive, and results-driven Outbound Sales Coordinator to support and manage our outbound sales initiatives. You’ll be part of a dynamic team that partners with innovative brands to deliver high-impact, data-driven marketing strategies. ed the same day they are collected

title: Contract Web Developer (Project-Based)
description:
ABOUT DISPENZA

Dispenza has quickly become one of the largest marketing agencies in the rapidly-growing emerging market of cannabis as it quickly legalizes state by state in the Americas. As the market matures, we are on a mission to help change how the market operates, leaving the more questionable activities done by current market leaders and emerge as the first marketing agency and platform that values our customers while simultaneously delivering business-changing results to our clients.



JOB OVERVIEW

We’re hiring contract web developers for ongoing project-based website builds / conversions (typically 5–10 pages per site). This is not a full-time role - work is assigned per project.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

- Build pages in WordPress using Elementor / Elementor Pro (page builder experience required)

- Build pages in SGEN using its page builder (Elementor-like)

- Convert existing sites/designs into clean, responsive page builds (Figma/PSD/reference site ? live pages)

- Basic setup + polish: mobile responsiveness, spacing/typography consistency, speed-minded builds



TEAM COLLABORATION

- Working alongside project managers to complete tasks as part of the team’s development process.

- Participating in tea
etings to discuss project progress and suggest new tools or techniques.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Strong portfolio of live sites (page-build focused)

- Comfortable learning a new builder quickly (SGEN builder is similar to Elementor)

- Detail-oriented, reliable, deadline-driven

- Clear communication (quick updates, asks good questions)



DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- WP builders: WPBakery, Divi (Elementor is primary)

- ACF, CPT, basic theme/plugin troubleshooting

- Shopify ? WordPress migrations or landing page builds



COMPENSATION

Project-based pay (per site / per batch of pages).



SCHEDULE

- 8 hour shift, Tuesday to Saturday, 7:00am to 4:00pm Manila Time.

- Minimal overtime during weekdays and weekends will be expected as part of salary



Dispenza is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, wordpressage, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.





HOW TO APPLY

- Please fill out the following form in order for your application to be considered: 

- Must complete a paid test task (small page build).

- Passing the test = eligible for ongoing paid projects.



Good luck!

 business pages

 Ads Manager

title: Chief Operating Officer (COO)
description:
Compensation

USD $5,000 – $6,000 per month, depending on experience

Work Setup: Remote

Reports To: CEO



How to Apply:

To apply, please complete this form:





We are seeking an experienced Chief Operating Officer (COO) to lead overall business operations, revenue performance, and organizational execution across client accounts and internal teams.



This role is responsible for driving operational strategy, scaling systems, improving profitability, and ensuring strong leadership across department heads. The COO will work closely with the CEO and leadership team to optimize performance, team structure, and operational efficiency.



Teams Overseen: Operations, Sales, Messaging, Support, and Department Managers



Key Responsibilities

Operations & Strategy

- Lead day-to-day company operations and ensure execution aligns with business goals

- Build scalable systems, workflows, and SOPs to improve efficiency and profitability

- Monitor key business metrics including revenue growth, operational efficiency, retention, and cost control

- Identify operational risks and implement solutions proactively

- Drive monthly and quarterly initiatives with clear KPIs and accountability



Leadership & Team Management

- Lead and mentor department heads, supervisors, and operational leaders

- Build strong accountability structures and performance management systems

- Oversee hiring strategy, leadership development, and organizational structure

- Improve cross-team collaboration and communication

- Maintain high team morale while enforcing performance standards



Performance, Quality & Reporting

- Establish dashboards and reporting systems for leadership visibility

- Ensure operational quality, compliance, and account security standards

- Oversee revenue optimization strategies and performance improvements

- Present weekly and monthly performance insights with actionable recommendations

- Support decision-making through data-driven analysis



Qualifications

Required Experience

- Minimum 4+ years of leadership experience in operations, business management, or scaling teams

- Proven experience managing managers or department leaders

- Background in digital businesses, online sales, creator platforms, or subscription-based environments is a strong advantage



Skills & Traits

- Strong strategic thinking with hands-on execution ability

- Excellent leadership, coaching, and decision-making skills

- Data-driven with strong business and revenue awareness

- Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple departments

- Clear communicator with strong accountability and ownership mindset

- Strong focus on compliance, risk management, and operational stability

Job Title: Property Management Coordinator (US Real estate and Property Management industry)

Location: REMOTE

Working hours: Monday-Friday, 9am-6pm US Pacific time (subject to change)

Rate: starting $4.00 per hour DOE (Please apply ONLY if you are OKAY with our rate)



NOTE: We use HUBSTAFF as our timekeeping system and productivity monitoring tool, WORKING HOURS IS US PACIFIC TIME -- IF YOU ARE OKAY WITH THIS, PLEASE APPLY. THANK YOU.



TO APPLY: PLEASE PROVIDE A GOOGLE DRIVE LINK WHICH CONTAINS YOUR UPDATED COPY OF RESUME IN PDF AND PORTFOLIO IF APPLICABLE. THANK YOU. PLEASE MAKE SURE THAT THE LINK IS VIEWABLE/ACCESSIBLE.



The Cal Agents Realty is seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Property Management Coordinator with a strong understanding of property management principles and practices to join our rapidly growing team. This is a unique opportunity to play a crucial role in the day-to-day operations of our property management department ensuring smooth and efficient management of our properties. 



About the Role:



The Property Management Coordinator provides administrative and operational support to the Property Manager and assists in the day-to-day management of assigned properties.  This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, excellent communication, and a customer-service oriented approach.



Responsibilities:



Administrative Support:



Answer phone calls and
s from tenants, owners, and vendors.

Maintain accurate records of tenant information, lease agreements, and property documents.

Prepare and send out notices (e.g., rent reminders, lease renewals).

Process invoices and payments.

Assist with budget preparation and tracking.

Schedule and coordinate property inspections and maintenance.



Tenant Relations:



Respond to tenant inquiries and requests in a timely and professional manner.

Assist with tenant move-in and move-out procedures.

Address tenant complaints and concerns.

Foster positive tenant relationships.



Property Operations:



Coordinate with vendors for property maintenance and repairs.

Monitor property condition and identify potential issues.

Ensure compliance with property regulations and safety standards.

Assist with property showings and lease signings.



Other:



Provide support to the Property Manager with various tasks and projects.

Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.

Perform other duties as assigned.



Qualifications:



Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Real Estate, or related field preferred.

1-2 years of experience in property management or administrative support role.   

Strong organizational and time management skills.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).   

Knowledge of property management software is a plus.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.   

Customer service oriented with a positive attitude.



To Apply:



Please apply by providing a Google link drive containing your updated resume and cover letter. Please ensure that the link provided is viewable. 



The Cal Agents Realty is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Automation & Systems Specialist [GoHighLevel]
description:
Underpaid, Under-Appreciated, And Unfulfilled?

Your GHL Automations & Operations Skills Deserve More Than “Just Another Job”



You’re Not “Just a VA”

And deep down… you’ve known that for too long



There’s something different about how your mind works.



You don’t just follow instructions and complete tasks



You see how everything connects - Like Neil from the Matrix.

You notice inefficiencies others overlook.

You question why systems are structured the way they are.

You think in patterns. In logic. In architecture.



When something breaks, you don’t patch it...



You trace it.

You diagnose it.

You fix it properly.



And while you’re grateful for your current role…

You know it doesn’t fully use your capability.



It’s not about complaining.

It’s not about being ungrateful.



You’re loyal. You always have been.

But that quiet restlessness?



That feeling that you could be building something more meaningful?



That’s a sign that you’re put here for more, much more.



And ignoring that feeling doesn’t make it disappear.



THE MISSION BEHIND THE WORK 



We are Australia’s #1 Divorce Prevention & Relationship Recovery Organisation



Specialising in working with men whose marriages are close to breaking down and their families falling apart.



When our systems work properly:



• Families stay together longer

• Children grow up in happier & healthier homes

• Generational damage is prevented

• Lives are genuinely changed

• Communities are stronger



This is not random 'agency work'.

Or working in another ‘coaching business’

Nor is this just marketing automation...



This is infrastructure supporting families in crisis.



Some call it ‘God’s Work’.



We see it as our Mission and Duty



And strong backend systems make it possible!



YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT



#1, We respect and understand Filipino culture.



Family matters.

Stability matters.

Loyalty matters.

Being proud of your work matters.



We are building a long-term, structured team environment where:



•Your thinking is valued

• Your improvements are implemented

• Communication is calm and clear

• Expectations are structured

• Growth is real

• Performance increases are real



The Australian Time Zone AEST and working hours are perfectly aligned to support happier and healthier Filipino families.



This is not chaos

This is not micromanagement.

This is stable, consistent, mission-driven work with high standards.



THE ROLE - EXPERIENCED AUTOMATION AND SYSTEMS SPECIALIST 



We are not looking for “a VA.”



We are looking for an Experienced Systems & Automation Specialist.



You will:



• Build and optimise advanced workflows

• Diagnose automation failures and trace root causes

• Design clean tagging and segmentation architecture

• Prevent duplicate triggers and workflow collisions

• Improve CRM clarity and structure

• Integrate Stripe, Zapier, Pabbly, Webhooks and APIs

• QA test before deployment

• Document systems clearly

• Proactively suggest structural improvements



If you enjoy clean systems, logical architecture, this role will challenge and expand you.



WHAT MATTERS MOST FOR US - NON NEGOTIABLE



Critical thinking!



When something breaks, you must be able to:



1. Identify what happened

2. Find the root cause

3. Fix it properly

4. Prevent it from happening again



Silence when stuck is not acceptable.

Communication and ownership are essential.

You will always be met with respect, understanding, and listened to.

There are no mistakes - Only Learnings



WHAT SUCCESS WILL LOOK LIKE FOR YOU



If selected, you will begin with a 30-day paid trial period.



During this time, you will:



• Audit and map our automation systems

• Work closely with our experienced Operations & Systems Engineer

• Learn our workflow architecture

• Identify improvement opportunities



You will be supported.

But you will also be evaluated.



At the end of 30 days, if performance meets expectations, you will be offered:



• A permanent full-time contract

• Stable long-term work

• Ongoing performance-based growth

• Expanded responsibility as your capability grows



IMPORTANT: This is not freelance work!



We have and are expanding our long-term high-performance team.

You will be positioned with A Players - The best of the best, and be paid accordingly.



WE ONLY OPERATE WITH HIGH STANDARDS AND STRONG VALUES



This role requires real experience and knowledge



You must be comfortable:



• Diagnosing complex workflow failures

• Understanding automation sequencing logic

• Identifying trigger conflicts

• Designing scalable systems

• Explaining your thinking clearly



If your experience is surface-level, it will become clear VERY quickly.



The work we do impacts families in crisis



Leads cannot fall through cracks.

Systems cannot break silently.



There is too much at stake for 'guesswork' or 'winging it'.



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS [Important]



At the top of your application, write: ARCHITECT777



Applications without this word will not be reviewed.



In your application, include:



1. A short explanation of a complex workflow you built



2. A screenshot of a workflow with conditional logic



3. A description of a system issue you diagnosed and permanently solved



4. Your expected monthly salary (USD) based on full-time commitment

[We compensate based on capability, performance and long-term alignment]



FINAL NOTE: 



If you’re simply looking for another job, someone easy to do…

This probably isn’t it.



But if you’re looking for:



• Meaning

• Stability

• Growth

• Respect

• A mission to give you purpose 



Then we’d love to hear from you

Founder - Leonidas Sheed

title: Video Editor & Motion Designer
description:
Feed (
) is a creative video studio that turns founder 
nts, customer stories, and brand ideas into scroll-stopping, story-driven videos that feel human and convert. We specialize in crafting compelling short-form storytelling content. 



We’re looking for a Video Editor to help shape high-quality, story-driven short-form content from raw footage to final delivery. You’ll work closely with the Founder/Creative Strategist to bring ideas to life in a way that feels intentional, human, and visually polished. This role is for an editor who thinks in stories, not just timelines. Here are the types of videos you’ll be expected to make:

- 

- 

- 



This position will start part-time (~15-25 hours per week) so we can ensure a good fit on both sides. As trust and 
ntum build, there’s a clear path to transitioning into a full-time, long-term role with increased ownership and responsibility.



What You’ll Do

- Own the edit from raw footage to final delivery, shaping narrative structure, pacing, and emotional beats

- Edit short-form videos for TikTok, Reels, and other social platforms with a strong understanding of retention and flow

- Lead visual storytelling through motion graphics and animation, using effects intentionally to enhance the story

- Source and integrate b-roll or stock footage that meaningfully supports the narrative

- Collaborate closely with a Creative Strategist, contributing creative judgment and refining concepts through iteration

- Design and maintain motion assets such as lower thirds and animated information graphics

- Handle color correction and audio polishing to ensure a clean, consistent final product

- Manage files, versions, and deadlines independently in an async workflow



What We’re Looking For

- A portfolio that demonstrates strong storytelling, pacing, and motion design - not just technical edits

- Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects

- Deep understanding of narrative structure (hook ? context ? tension ? payoff)

- Strong motion design fundamentals (timing, easing, visual hierarchy)

- Confident audio storytelling skills (music selection, sound design, clean dialogue)

- Ability to make creative decisions independently and explain your reasoning

- Experience working from creative briefs and collaborating asynchronously (Slack, 
)

- Highly organized, reliable, and comfortable managing multiple versions and feedback cycles

- Familiarity with short-form platforms and social-first editing conventions

- Bonus: Photoshop or basic design experience



Note: A portfolio is required for your application to be considered.



Part-Time Salary: $1,000.00

Salary will be adjusted upon joining full-time, based on experience

title: Senior Accountant / Management Accountant
description:
Senior Accountant (AU Client) – Xero Certified



Reports to: Managing Director

Location: Remote (Work From Home)

Employment Type: Full Time

Work Schedule: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Manila Time



About the Role



Staff Connect Australia is recruiting on behalf of an established Australian business operating across multiple service divisions.



We are seeking a high-level, Xero-accredited Senior Accountant to take full ownership of the company’s financial systems, reporting, and compliance. This long-term role reports directly to the Managing Director and requires a detail-driven professional who can independently manage accounting operations while delivering accurate reporting and actionable financial insights to support business decisions.



This role is ideal for someone experienced in Australian accounting standards, multi-entity structures, and operational financial reporting.



Systems & Tools Environment

Xero

GeoOp

Live Payments Portal

Airtable

Slack



Certifications Required

- Xero Advisor Certified

- Xero Payroll Certified



Required Experience

- Australian BAS and IAS preparation

- Company tax return support (liaising with external accountants as needed)

- Experience working with Australian clients or accounting firms



Key Responsibilities

Bookkeeping & Reconciliations

-Maintain accurate financial records in Xero for all entities

- Perform bank, credit card, and loan reconciliations

- Allocate GST codes and track job-related costs

- Review and code expense entries with proper documentation

- Reconcile inter-entity transactions and maintain a clean general ledger

-

Accounts Payable (Suppliers & Contractors)

- Process and schedule invoices for payment

- Verify invoice accuracy against purchase orders or job references

- Reconcile supplier statements and maintain positive relationships

- Process weekly contractor payments and maintain payout registers

-

Accounts Receivable (Customer Billing & Collections)

- Review job logs from GeoOp and ensure accurate invoicing

- Identify and correct invoicing/data-entry errors

- Manage debtor follow-ups and resolve invoice disputes

- Maintain an accurate aged receivables ledger and report trends



Payroll & Contractor Management

- Process fortnightly payroll in compliance with Australian award rules

- Audit ove
 claims for accuracy and fairness

- Reconcile PAYG, superannuation, and leave balances

- Maintain employee and contractor payment records

- Post and reconcile all payroll journals



Balance Sheet, Assets & Financial Control

- Maintain reconciled balance sheets each month

- Manage the fixed asset register and depreciation schedules

- Record and monitor capital purchases (vehicles, IT, plant, and equipment)

- Administer dividend payments, director loans, and shareholder distributions

- Track intercompany transactions, retained earnings, and equity movements



BAS / IAS Preparation & Compliance

- Prepare monthly IAS and quarterly BAS for review

- Ensure GST and PAYG data is accurate

- Maintain full working papers and supporting documentation

- Monitor ATO correspondence and ensure timely compliance



Financial & Operational Reporting

- Produce weekly cashflow forecasts and monthly management reports

- Conduct variance analysis and identify cost-saving opportunities

- Track workforce utilization, revenue per labour hour, and service profitability

- Provide actionable insights for management, including pricing and discount analysis



Audit & Year-End Support

- Prepare reconciliations and schedules for audits and EOFY processes

- Liaise with external accountants and auditors

- Assist with year-end adjustments, including depreciation, accruals, and provisions



Key Skills & Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent

- Minimum 3+ years’ experience with Australian clients or accounting firms

- Advanced Xero proficiency, including payroll, fixed assets, and reporting

- Strong knowledge of Australian BAS, GST, PAYG, and Superannuation compliance

- Experience managing balance sheets, dividends, and inter-entity accounts

- Excellent accounts payable, receivable, and reconciliation skills

- Strong analytical and financial reporting capability

- High attention to detail and accuracy

- Able to work independently and proactively identify risks or opportunities



Performance Indicators (KPIs)

- Balance sheets reconciled monthly with full supporting schedules

- Zero unexplained variances in payroll, assets, or BAS accounts

- Timely issuance of invoices and active debtor management

- Accurate and punctual supplier and contractor payments

- Management reports delivered with insightful commentary on trends and efficiencies

- Workforce utilization, cancellations, and discount impacts reported monthly

- BAS/IAS submissions prepared ahead of deadlines

- EOFY and audit documentation complete and delivered on time

title: Full-Time Video Editor
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled, full-time video editor to join our team.



Your primary responsibility will be transforming long-form YouTube vlogs into highly engaging vertical Shorts (10 seconds to 60 seconds) for YouTube Shorts and TikTok.



This is not basic clipping work. We are looking for someone who understands pacing, framing, and viral short-form storytelling.

This role is long-term and may expand into additional creative opportunities as we grow.



Core Responsibilities:



• Watch full-length YouTube vlogs (horizontal format)

• Identify the most exciting, emotional, funny, or dramatic 
nts

• Cut those 
nts into short-form clips (10–60 seconds)

• Convert horizontal footage into vertical format (9:16)

• Adjust cropping and framing precisely to keep key subjects centered

• Manually reframe shots when needed (frame-by-frame adjustments when required)

• Add subtitles, captions, zooms, and pacing enhancements when appropriate

• Deliver optimized clips for YouTube Shorts and TikTok



The shorts must feel exciting and viral-ready.



Technical Requirements (Mandatory):



You must:



• Be highly experienced with professional editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut Pro, or similar)

• Understand vertical reframing techniques

• Be able to dynamically crop and reframe horizontal footage for vertical

• Understand how to keep subjects properly centered

• Have strong pacing and storytelling instincts

• Understand viral short-form content structure

• Be comfortable working independently



You must be able to download YouTube videos in high quality.

We will provide access to premium software for this at no cost.



Creative Requirements:



• Strong understanding of U.S. family-style vlog content

• Ability to recognize emotional beats and viral 
nts

• Strong instinct for what performs on Shorts and TikTok

• Ability to make clips feel high-energy and engaging



This is not just technical editing — you must understand the audience.

This Is NOT for Beginners



Do NOT apply if:



• You only have basic editing skills

• You have never created viral short-form content

• You cannot properly reframe horizontal footage for vertical

• You cannot confidently identify high-retention 
nts



All candidates will be required to complete 1–2 short test edits to demonstrate skill level.



Schedule:



• Full-time position

• Consistent weekly workload

• Long-term opportunity



To Apply, please include:



1. A brief explanation of how you choose viral 
nts from long videos

2. Your editing software

3. Your internet speed

4. Confirmation that you are comfortable completing a short test edit



We are looking for someone who takes pride in their work and wants to grow with a serious content team.



Only experienced editors will be considered.

title: ADMIN EXECUTIVE (B2B, WATSONS, GUARDIAN, WELCIA, BIGSELLER, URSTORE)
description:
Join our team as part of a dynamic, global team of 40 across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia and Philippines. 

In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of Korean brands such as Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir and other top of trend Korean brands.

We are looking for a driven, and detail-oriented tea
mber to support our brand’s growth across digital and offline channels. You will play a key role in processing POs, coordinating marketing campaigns, managing events, and driving strategies that connect with our beauty brand presence.



Key Responsibilities:



- Work closely with the Channel Lead Manager to support marketing initiatives for key retail accounts (e.g., Watsons, Guardian, DONKI etc.).

- Regularly check the B2B portal system and compile new Purchase Orders (POs).

- Perform data entry of PO details into the internal databases.

- Monitor PO fulfillment and non-fulfillment status.

- Generate Sales Orders in the Bigseller or Urstore and create corresponding Delivery Order forms.

- Coordinate with the warehouse team for all Purchase Orders.

- Support the end-to-end execution of offline activation events, including preparation of marketing collaterals, ensure timely delivery and accuracy of all promotional content across platforms.

- Coordinate new product launches and ensure smooth operations for stock replenishment, product creation, and promotion setups.

- Organize and maintain critical documents, contracts, and records related to channel activities.

- Assist in planning and executing effective marketing campaigns aligned with brand strategy and objectives.

- Collaborate with other departments for adhoc tasks.



Qualifications:

- at least 1-3 relevant working experience in channel admin, trade admin, or any related field.

- Proficient in Google sheets and Excel. Managing large datasets, utilizing advanced formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables).

- Experience working in the retail, Korean brands retail, marketing, B2B or ecommerce sector.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel opportunity in Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage.







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you

title: Real Estate Video/Photograpy Editor
description:
About Us

Bolder Digital is an Australian-based recruitment agency committed to connecting top Filipino talent with leading businesses globally. We are looking for an individual to join our team and work remotely from the Philippines as we are based in Australia (Remote, based in the Philippines, working on Australian Eastern Time Zone 8/9 AM – 5 PM).



Job Type

Full-Time – Long term/Gig



Start Date:

ASAP



Compensation:

Negotiable — based on proven expertise



Overview

We are hiring an elite Video Editor with advanced, professional-level experience in real estate, construction, architecture, and promotional brand content.



This role requires someone who has spent years working in high-pressure commercial environments — someone who understands tight turnarounds, precision editing, narrative flow, and the visual standards required in premium marketing.



You’ll be working across:

High-end real estate property videos

Builder & construction showcases

Architectural features & design storytelling

Promotional brand edits for businesses

If you don’t have industry-proven commercial experience, don’t apply.

If you do — we want you.



Key Responsibilities

Real Estate, Construction & Promo Editing

Edit cinematic, high-impact property videos showcasing interiors, exteriors, lifestyle elements, architecture, and land features

Build fast-turnaround construction progress videos, promo reels, project showcases, and brand storytelling pieces

Craft engaging short-form edits for Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts using clean pacing, crisp sound design, and strong narrative structure

Masterfully repurpose long-form shoots into multiple content deliverables

Apply brand identity, graphics, typography, colour grading, and transitions with consistency and precision

Creative Execution & Collaboration

Work from raw media and briefs to produce polished, broadcast-level edits

Take constructive criticism without ego — improve, iterate, and refine

Work efficiently under pressure, meeting tight deadlines and high-volume demands

Communicate clearly with our internal team and clients across review cycles



Optional but Preferred

Photo editing experience in Photoshop & Lightroom

Ability to design static promotional assets (carousels, quotes, graphic posts)

Strong understanding of brand identity and visual strategy



Portfolio Requirements

Submit 10–15 examples of:

Real estate, construction, or architectural video edits

Promotional commercial edits

title: Part-Time Operations Coordinator (Detail-Driven)
description:
???? READ FIRST

This is not an hourly role. This is a part-time, availability-based support role paid on a monthly retainer.



Top priority: attention to detail + proactive follow-up.

This role is light on workload (1–4 hours/day) but high on standards: clean execution, self-checking before submitting, and closing loops without reminders.



You are paid for:

- Availability during a defined window

- Fast acknowledgement

- Accurate execution (detail matters)

- Proactive follow-up and communication



? Availability & Responsiveness

- Availability window: Mon–Sat, 12:00 PM to 6:00 PM Bali Time (Asia/Makassar)



Availability means:

- You are reachable and able to execute tasks during this window

- You can do other work as long as you remain responsive and reliable



Availability does NOT mean:

- You are working nonstop for 6 hours

- You are “always on” outside the window



Response expectation: acknowledge messages within 10 minutes during the window.

Two ideal acknowledgements:



“I’ll do this now.” OR “Got it. I’ll complete this by [time] today.”

If you cannot meet the 10-minute standard on a specific day, notify me before the window starts.



? Daily Check-ins (simple)

12:00 PM start of day: priorities + estimated completion times + blockers

5:30–6:00 PM end of day: ? completed / ???? in progress / ? blocked

If no tasks: “All clear. Available.”



???? CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

1) ???? Project Co-ordination



- Track tasks, owners, and due dates

- Follow up with suppliers, collaborators, and contacts

- Close loops independently (no reminders needed)

- Help founder organize projects and stay on track

- Format Excel documents + simple data analysis

- Light, practical research when requested

- Create and maintain simple SOPs in Notion

- Create and maintain files and spreadsheets (Google Sheets) as needed



???? CONTENT SUPPORT  (Meta)

- Schedule posts using Meta

- Schedule content according to the existing strategy

- Provide simple insights on engagement and content performance

- Keep content organized and consistent with existing patterns

- You will be provided photos/copy/examples. You will not create content from scratch.



????? KLAYVIO
 MARKETING (Bonus)

- Experience setting up high converting
 campaigns



SHOPIFY & ETSY LISTINGS 

- Update titles, descriptions, variants, pricing, images using SEO 

- Follow existing formats and naming conventions



? What This Role Is NOT

- Not hourly   - Not strategy leadership  - Not content creation from scratch - Not management - Not a training role requiring hand-holding



???? TRIAL PERIOD-  2-week paid trial  compensated at $150 USD

We evaluate: responsiveness, check-ins, accuracy, follow-through, proactivity, and reduction of mental load.



???? COMPENSATION 

- Monthly retainer: $275 USD + KPI-based bonuses. Paid monthly via Wise or bank transfer.



Bonuses (summary):

Response + check-ins compliance required for any bonus eligibility

Loop closure required

Accuracy bonus and proactivity bonus awarded monthly based on targets (shared during onboarding)

Peak periods may require extra support and may be compensated (+$50–$100 by agreement).



???? HOW TO APPLY (Required)

Application check: Start your application with HORUS



Then include:

- Your location + time zone

- Confirmation you can do Mon–Sat, 12 to 6pm Bali time

- Confirmation you can meet 10-minute response time

- Relevant experience (Project Management, Klayvio, Meta, Shopify/Etsy)



The word CONFIRMED followed by this sentence copied exactly:

“I understand the role requires daily check-ins, response time compliance, and high attention to detail.”



Applications that do not follow the instructions above will not be reviewed.

title: ADVANCED VIDEO EDITOR
description:
Senior Video Editor (Adobe Premiere Pro & After Effects) – Long-Term, Full-Time Potential



Overview-

We are a fast-growing creative media company undergoing a full business restructure and expansion. We produce high-volume, high-quality short-form and long-form video content for brands, creators, and businesses across multiple industries.

We are seeking elite-level video editors in the Philippines to join our core team long-term. This is not a short-term gig. We are looking for editors who want stability, growth, and ownership within a structured, professional editing pipeline.



Only experienced editors with excellent English communication skills and a proven professional portfolio will be considered.



Core Responsibilities:

Edit short-form and long-form video content efficiently and accurately

Execute clean, modern, fast-paced edits optimized for social media platforms

Apply advanced cuts, pacing, captions, sound design, and visual polish

Use Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects at an advanced level

Follow creative direction, brand guidelines, and written/video instructions

Meet strict deadlines without exception

Collaborate with other editors, producers, and project leads

Problem-solve independently when files, footage, or instructions are unclear

Adapt quickly to feedback and revisions

Maintain consistent quality across high output volumes



Mandatory Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Applicants who do not meet all requirements below will not be considered.

10/10 English proficiency (spoken and written)

4+ years of professional video editing experience

Expert-level Adobe Premiere Pro skills

Expert-level Adobe After Effects skills

Proven ability to edit quickly without sacrificing quality

Ability to submit projects on or before deadlines

Ability to understand English creative concepts, tone, and intent

Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends when needed

Willingness to work overtime during high-volume periods

Strong team collaboration and communication skills

Strong independent problem-solving ability

Reliable internet connection and professional workstation

Portfolio submission is required (best work only)



Preferred (Strong Advantages)

Experience editing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

Experience working in an agency or high-output content environment

Strong sense of pacing, storytelling, and viewer retention

Experience with captions, subtitles, and social-optimized formatting

Familiarity with 
, Google Drive workflows, and shared project pipelines

Understanding of brand consistency and content systems

Ability to follow SOPs while improving workflows proactively

Personal Traits We Are Looking For

Extremely reliable and deadline-driven

Detail-oriented and quality-focused

Calm under pressure during high workloads

Coachable, open to feedback, and improvement-oriented

Proactive communicator (does not wait until deadlines to raise issues)

Long-term mindset — interested in growing with the company



What We Offer

Long-term, stable work with consistent volume

Clear systems, workflows, and expectations

Opportunity to become a core team editor as the company scales

Performance-based growth opportunities and increased responsibility

Professional, structured environment (not freelance chaos)



How to Apply

To be considered, you must submit:

A brief introduction about yourself

Your best video editing portfolio (links only)

Your total years of professional editing experience

Confirmation that you meet all mandatory requirements

Applications without a portfolio will not be reviewed.

description:

Strong eye for layout, spacing, and typography



Knows:

Hook timing (first 1–3 seconds)

Video pacing

Retention editing techniques

Studies viral formats and trends

Hook structure

Pattern interrupts

POV style videos

Carousel formatting

Can suggest trends — not just wait for instructions



This is not just a “video cutter.”

This is a content optimizer.

Has a good eye for clean, premium visuals

Fast turnaround time

Proactive communicator

Understands deadlines

Comfortable giving suggestions

Fast learner

5. Ideal Experience

Founders

Mom / lifestyle / wellness brands

title: Virtual Level 1 Support Analyst
description:
About Us



At Schnitz, we are passionate about bringing people together over delicious, fresh, hand-crafted schnitzels. With over 80 stores across Australia, we’re on a mission to make healthy, feel-good food that tastes great and makes people happy.

You can check us out here:  
/?srsltid=AfmBOoqJ222g9_qcc79-wDHM6sZJsGVDN1Ua6F7MoWmz48OdgaDVQu_f



We are now looking for two Virtual Level 1 Support Analysts to join our growing team and help us deliver exceptional IT support to our franchisees and internal teams.



The Role



As a Virtual Level 1 Support Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our franchisees and staff, providing friendly and efficient technical support. You’ll handle inquiries via phone,
, and our ticketing system, helping to keep our POS systems, networks, and back-of-house applications running smoothly.



You’ll also assist the IT Team with administrative tasks and ensure we deliver consistent, high-quality IT service across our network.



This is a remote role supporting Australian hours, so flexibility to work rotational shifts (including weekends and public holidays) is essential.



Key Responsibilities

Provide Level 1 technical support for:

*POS systems

*Internet and Wi-Fi networks

*Back-of-house applications

*Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network issues remotely.

*Monitor systems to proactively identify and address potential issues.

*Install, configure, and maintain software across the Schnitz network.

*Escalate complex problems to senior IT staff when needed.

*Maintain accurate records of i
, resolutions, and processes.

*Provide user training and guidance to hospitality staff when required.

*Support data security and compliance with IT policies and local regulations.

*Collaborate with the on-site IT team to ensure seamless service delivery.



About You

Experience in remote IT support or service desk roles (preferred).

Familiarity with remote support tools (e.g. TeamViewer) and restaurant/QSR systems (advantageous).

Solid understanding of Windows/Mac OS, networking basics, and cloud-based tools.

Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

A customer-focused, solution-oriented mindset.

Flexible to work rotational shifts, including weekends and public holidays.



Why Join Us?



Be part of a growing, supportive team in a national brand.



Work remotely and support a business that’s all about great food and happy people.



Opportunity to grow your IT skills in a fast-paced hospitality environment.



Ready to apply?



If you’re passionate about IT support and think this role is for you, please click the link below to apply.





Please note: we will not be responding on this platform, so please apply through the link above. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted.



Kind Regards,



The Schnitz Team

title: Virtual Permit & Paperwork Coordinator
description:
Primary Role Objective (Core Need):



This role exists to own and streamline the permitting and inspection process for residential AC changeouts and installations. The Virtual Permit & Paperwork Coordinator will be responsible for ensuring permits are submitted correctly, inspections are scheduled and tracked, and all documentation is complete — saving the owner and field team significant time as volume increases. This is a high-leverage role that directly supports operational scale.



Primary Responsibilities (Top Priority):



- Permitting & Inspection Coordination (Primary Focus)

* Submit online permits for residential AC installations and changeouts.

* Schedule and coordinate city/county inspections.

* Upload required photos and supporting documentation for inspections.

* Track inspection statuses, including:

1. Passed inspections

2. Failed inspections

3. Re-trips and re-inspections

* Follow up with municipalities to resolve permitting or inspection issues.

* Maintain an organized permit tracker (by job, address, status, inspector notes).

* Ensure all permits are closed out properly after final inspection.



This role becomes a huge time saver as the business completes more changeouts and installations.



Secondary Responsibilities (Supporting the Core Role)



- Administrative & Paperwork Support

* Maintain organized digital files for permits, inspections, and job documentation.

* Assist with general admin tasks related to jobs and projects.

* Update internal records, spreadsheets, or CRM systems as needed.

* Support internal coordination between office and field technicians.



Communication & Coordination:



 * Communicate professionally with:

1.City / county permitting offices

2. Inspectors

3. Internal tea
mbers

* Escalate issues proactively when delays or problems arise.

title: TikTok Account Specialist (TikTok Shop experience is a big plus!) )
description:
TikTok Account Specialist

Remote | Full-Time



We’re looking for a TikTok-native Account Specialist to own and grow our TikTok presence and TikTok Shop in the health supplement space. This role goes beyond posting videos — you’ll be responsible for content performance, creator partnerships, and TikTok Shop revenue growth.



If you love TikTok, understand what makes content sell (not just go viral), have a personal interest in health & wellbeing and want a role where your work directly impacts results — this is for you.



Who are we?

Founded by two women and driven by a genuine passion for improving people’s health, this science-based supplement brand creates products using high-quality ingredients at therapeutic doses designed to deliver real impact.



You’ll be joining a small, dynamic, international team working across multiple time zones. This role suits someone who is self-driven, confident in taking initiative, enjoys diving into the details, and thrives on learning and continuous growth.





What You’ll Be Responsible For



1. TikTok & TikTok Shop Management

- Manage and grow the brand TikTok account

- Upload, optimise, and manage TikTok Shop product listings

- Optimise product titles, descriptions, videos, and offers for conversion

- Monitor TikTok Shop analytics and sales performance



2. Content Strategy & Execution

- Build and manage a TikTok content calendar

- Repurpose existing brand content into TikTok-native formats

- Identify trends, hooks, and formats that drive engagement and sales

- Test, analyse, and optimise content performance



3. Creator & Affiliate Management

- Create clear briefs for UGC and TikTok creators

- Source, onboard, and manage creators and affiliates

- Conduct creator outreach and relationship management

- Track creator performance and scale high-ROI partnerships



4. Reporting & Optimisation

- Track key KPIs (views, engagement, conversion, sales)

- Share insights and recommendations with the team

- Continuously improve performance based on data



What We’re Looking For

- Strong understanding of TikTok trends, culture, and content styles

- Experience managing TikTok accounts or TikTok Shop (brand, agency, or creator side)

- Comfortable working with creators and UGC

- Data-driven mindset — you look at numbers, not just likes

- Excellent written English for briefs and communication

- Proactive, organised, and able to work independently

- A passion for the health and wellbeing space



TikTok Shop experience is a big plus!

13th Month Pay

Fully remote work

Clear growth path as TikTok Shop scales

Work directly with a fast-growing brand (not an agency juggling clients)



Why You’ll Love This Role

You’ll own a channel that directly drives revenue

Your ideas and execution actually matter
