title: Motion Graphics Artist Wanted — History YouTube Channel (Mongol Empire Series)
description:
We run a history YouTube channel and we're looking for a motion graphics artist to work on our upcoming series covering the Mongol Empire — steppe politics, tribal warfare, and the absolutely unhinged characters and events that built the largest contiguous empire in history. We lean hard into the absurdity of it all, because frankly, history was wild and deserves to be treated that way.



What You'll Be Making

This role is focused entirely on motion graphics and map work — not editing. Specifically:



Animated maps showing tribal territories, troop movements, and the shifting political landscape of medieval Asia

Motion graphics for family trees and genealogies (these get complicated fast — Mongol lineage is a lot)

Timelines, key event graphics, and title/name cards

Anything else visual that helps the audience keep up with genuinely complex historical content



What We're Looking For



Strong motion graphics skills — After Effects preferred, but show us what you've got

Experience creating animated maps, or a clear willingness to develop that skill

An eye for pacing — the graphics need to land with the narration, not fight it

Ability to handle complex historical content and make it visually clear without dumbing it down

Reliable communication and turnaround



Bonus Points



You've worked on history, documentary, or educational content before

You have a portfolio that includes map animations or data visualisation work

You can make complex information feel exciting rather than like a school lesson



The Opportunity:



This is Episode 1 of a series. If we like your work, there's a lot more to come — we're planning a full run covering the rise of Genghis Khan through to the full empire. We're also offering a paid test task before committing to the full episode, so you'll know exactly what you're getting into.

To Apply

Send us your portfolio or showreel — especially anything with map animations or historical/documentary work. Include your rate (per project or per hour) and a rough sense of your typical turnaround.

title: Video Editor & UGC Outreach VA – Cooking App
description:
We're a newly launched cooking app looking for a talented and driven Virtual Assistant to join our growing team. This is a ground-floor opportunity. You'll be one of our first hires, meaning real ownership of your work and a direct line to growth as the app scales.





What You'll Be Doing

You'll split your time between two core areas: editing short-form video content for our social media channels, and managing outreach to UGC creators and food influencers. On the video side, you'll be cutting and polishing raw footage into engaging, scroll-stopping clips optimized for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts. On the outreach side, you'll be identifying potential creator partners, sending outreach messages, tracking responses, and helping manage ongoing UGC relationships.





What We're Looking For

Strong written and spoken English is a must - you'll be communicating directly with creators on our behalf, so clarity and professionalism matter. You should have solid video editing experience with a genuine understanding of what makes short-form content perform. Whether that's pacing, trending audio, captions, or hooks - you get it. Experience with tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, or DaVinci Resolve is ideal.

A passion or background in food and cooking is a big plus. This app is all about helping people cook better, so enthusiasm for the niche will come through in your work.





The Details



- Part-time: 20 hours per week

- Compensation: ?20,000/month

- Fully remote, flexible hours

- High likelihood of transitioning to full-time as the app grows, plus bonuses and pay increases to match





Why Join Us

We just launched, which means you won't be one of a hundred employees. You'll be a key part of building something from the ground up. The people who come in early will have the most to gain as the app grows.

If you love food content, know how to make videos that hook people in the first three seconds, and are organised enough to manage creator outreach without things falling through the cracks, we'd love to hear from you.





To Apply

Please send portfolio of your best short-form videos you've edited (for socials, ecommerce, etc)., and a description on why you'd be a great fit.

title: Ads Specialist
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a highly creative and detail-oriented Ad Specialist who will primarily focus on producing high-converting ad creatives for paid traffic campaigns. This role is 70–80% creative production and concept development.



You will be responsible for creating new ad angles, designing short-form video creatives, static graphics, and carousel ads that are specifically built for conversion.



This is not a media buying role. You will not be responsible for campaign strategy, budget management, or setting ads live. You will also support backend implementation by loading creatives into Meta Business Manager and organizing assets properly, but final campaign launches and optimization decisions will be handled separately.



We are looking for someone who understands the difference between content that looks good and content that performs.



About the Company

Valley Virtual Operations supports online business owners with systems, operations, and strategic backend support so they can scale sustainably without burning out. We help entrepreneurs build stronger foundations, create structure in their day-to-day operations, and streamline their workflows so their businesses can grow with ease.



We value efficiency, clarity, communication, and people who genuinely love helping things “just work” better. Our environment is collaborative, supportive, and built around doing great work while still being human.



Responsibilities Will Include:



Ad Creative Development (70–80%)



Developing multiple creative angles for campaigns

Creating short-form video ads (Reels-style creatives)

Designing static and carousel ads in Canva

Writing compelling hooks and short ad copy

Testing different messaging variations

Refreshing creatives to prevent ad fatigue

Understanding how to design for conversion, not just aesthetics

Generate new ideas based on performance trends



Backend Ad Support (20%)



Uploading new creatives into Meta Business Manager

Organizing ads within existing campaign structures

Duplicating ads for testing purposes

Ensuring assets are properly named and categorized

Follow campaign structure instructions



You do NOT need to know how to run or optimize ads.

You only need to be comfortable navigating the platform.



Analytics Awareness (Light – 10%)



Reviewing performance metrics such as CTR and CPC

Identifying when creatives need refreshing

Sharing insights based on performance trends

- This role requires basic comfort reading metrics, not deep analytical expertise.



Software / Platforms We Use:

Meta Business Manager, Canva, Adobe, Google Drive, ClickUp, Instagram,
, Loom



This Position IS for you if…



You love creating ad creatives designed to convert

You understand hooks, angles, and testing

You are comfortable navigating Meta Business Manager (even if you are not a media buyer)

You can read and analyze CTR, CPC, ROAS (even at basic level)

You are organized and detail-oriented

You take ownership of your creative output

You meet deadlines consistently

You’re reliable, organized, and take pride in doing things right

You communicate well and aren’t afraid to ask questions when needed

The keyword for this position is Scaling.



This Position is NOT for you if…



You are only experienced in organic social media

You want to manage ad budgets or full campaign strategy

You’re not detail-oriented or overlook instructions

You need constant direction

You are uncomfortable working inside backend platforms

You struggle with deadlines or keeping tasks organized



How to Apply:

If you are excited about this opportunity and feel as though you would be a strong fit to support ad creative production and backend ad support, please fill out this form: 
 

I appreciate your interest in becoming a valuable part of my team. I will be in touch with those that will be moving forward in the hiring process.

title: Senior Software Engineer – Data Infrastructure
description:
40 hours per week

9 AM–12 PM CST (10pm to 1am PHT) for meetings and then remaining hours will be FLEXIBLE



About the Role

We’re building a modern education infrastructure that’s AI-powered, insight-driven and student-centered. As our Senior Software Engineer – Data Infrastructure, you will play a foundational role in scaling our data systems to support advanced analytics, automation, and machine learning across the entire student lifecycle.

This role is both deeply technical and cross-functional: You’ll own the pipelines, integrations and backend systems that power real-time dashboards, AI tools and predictive intelligence while also building internal front-end tools to help staff interact with data, AI outputs and operational automations. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on clean architecture, robust automation, and building systems that just work: securely, reliably and at scale.



What You’ll Do

Data Integration & Engineering

- Design, build and maintain robust, secure data pipelines that ingest data from multiple external systems (Pipedrive, Disco, Google Classroom, Typeform, and more)

- Ensure high reliability through error handling, retries, status monitoring and logging

- Automate extraction, transformation and loading (ETL/ELT) of structured and semi-structured data using Python and SQL

- Normalize and enrich data to support dashboards, predictive models and staff tools



Infrastructure & Reliability

- Implement and enforce role-based access control, IAM policies and audit logs to meet SOC 2 and FERPA standards

- Build and monitor health checks and alerts for pipeline failures, data lags and schema mismatches

- Optimize our warehouse structure for performance, scalability and modular reuse across analytics and AI

- Set up job orchestration and scheduling using tools like Airflow, Prefect or AWS-native alternatives (e.g. Step Functions, EventBridge + Lambda)



Front-End Engineering & Tooling

- Develop internal-facing tools for interacting with AI systems, reviewing model outputs, approving automation actions or viewing student timelines

- Build lightweight tools in React, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS or use Streamlit for admin panels or dashboards

- Design intuitive workflows for staff-facing tools, annotation interfaces or moderation views

- Connect front-ends to cloud platforms (AWS, Snowflake), REST APIs, and internal services with appropriate authentication



Cross-Functional Collaboration

- Work closely with the Head of Data & AI Engineering, data analyst and product teams to prioritize technical work that supports critical operations

- Translate ambiguous data needs into scalable backend solutions

- Participate in data model design to ensure analytical and operational use cases are both supported and future-proof



Who You Are

Technical Expertise

- 5+ years of software engineering experience with a strong focus on backend or data systems

- Proven experience building data pipelines with Python, SQL, and cloud-native infrastructure (AWS preferred)

- Fluency in working with APIs and handling authentication, rate limits, pagination and error retries

- Comfortable working in AWS, building scalable, event-driven workflows with Lambda, Step Functions, S3 and Secrets Manager

- Familiarity with CI/CD, Docker, Git and monitoring tools (e.g., CloudWatch, Sentry, Prometheus)

- Experience with React + TypeScript and/or Streamlit for building internal tools or dashboards

- Proficiency in Snowflake, or similar cloud data warehouse (BigQuery, Redshift, etc.)

- Strong understanding of data security, compliance, and auditability (IAM, encryption, access logs, etc.)

- Experience with job orchestration tools like Airflow, Prefect, Dagster or AWS-native scheduling approaches



Communication & Collaboration

- Communicates clearly and effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders

- Proactive about identifying blockers, surfacing risks and suggesting architecture improvements

- Able to document systems thoroughly for both internal use and compliance purposes

- Comfortable operating autonomously while staying aligned with the broader data strategy

- Committed to quality, documentation and building for long-term scale and auditability



Personal Attributes

- Systematic thinker: you take pride in designing durable, maintainable solutions

- Detail-oriented with a strong bias for clean, observable, production-ready systems

- Excited by mission-driven work and curious about how education, AI and automation intersect

- Comfortable working in a lean, remote, fast-moving environment



Success in This Role Looks Like

- You’ve built and deployed data pipelines that are reliable, fast and trusted by analysts, product teams and AI systems.

- The organization no longer waits on manual data pulls or ad hoc integrations - your work has enabled self-serve insights and model-ready data.

- Data pipelines are monitored, logged and compliant with best practices for privacy and security.

- Errors are rare and quickly recoverable, thanks to strong observability.

- Your infrastructure supports real-time student risk scoring, career automation and coaching dashboards - making it easier for every team to do their job better and faster.

- You are seen as a strategic partner who builds for the long term, not just the next task.



Why Join Us

- Build from the Ground Up: You’ll help design and scale the backend infrastructure that powers AI tools, dashboards and automations across our entire student journey.

- Tech with Purpose: Every pipeline you build and system you secure helps reduce student dropout risk, improve coaching quality, and streamline job placement - this is impact engineering.

- Autonomy with Clarity: Work in an environment who values clean architecture, fast iteration, and long-term durability and gives you the space to execute.

- Modern Tooling: Snowflake, Python, React, AWS, dbt, API integrations: bring your experience and help define the future of our data stack.

- Real Stakeholder Influence: Collaborate with cross-functional teams where engineering is not a service function but a strategic partner.

- Compliance & Scale: If you care about doing things right: IAM, auditability, observability, schema hygiene - this is the right home.

- Clear Docs, Clear Minds: We care about good documentation, thoughtful planning and building systems that last

- Remote-First and Human-Centered: We believe you do your best work when you’re supported, trusted and working on something meaningful.



About Coding Temple



Coding Temple exists to unlock potential.



We help people do the most meaningful work of their lives, and help companies build the teams that make that possible.

We prepare individuals with the skills, confidence, and real-world experience to succeed from day one. For employers, we deliver job-ready talent trained to meet the demands of modern work. Whether it’s a career change or a hiring challenge, we exist to close the gap between potential and opportunity—because when that happens, lives change and companies grow.



Our Vision

We envision a world where anyone, regardless of age, origin, or socioeconomic status, can achieve financial independence and professional fulfillment.



Our Mission

Our mission is to Empower Prosperity by delivering capabilities to professionals and organizations that drive economic growth.



We do this by creating a Virtuous Organization, a place where employees derive deep meaning from their work and gain increasing passion and energy from their colleagues, customers, students, and collective results. Together, we create an environment where each person can do their very best work.



Our core values guide us:

- Gratitude & Appreciation

- Dignity & Respect

- Support & Compassion

- Caring & Concern

- Meaningfulness & Purpose

- Inspiration & Positive Energy

- Forgiveness & Understanding

- Trust & Integrity



PS. Please don't apply if you have less than 5 years of experience. Thank you!

Please apply with your updated CV and include a cover letter summarizing your Python and SQL skills.

title: Tax Specialist
description:
Yes We Vibe is a rapidly growing e-commerce business. We’re all about sharing good vibes with the world! You can check us out here: 



 We are looking to hire a Tax Specialist that is Responsible for U.S. and European tax processing and compliance.

This person will have a strong understanding of both U.S. federal, state, and local tax requirements, as well as European Value Added Tax (VAT) and corporate tax principles



We want to develop a long-term relationship with a person that is positive, meticulous, a team player and committed to the success of the company.



Position Overview

We're seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Global Tax Specialist to manage and ensure compliance with U.S. and European tax laws and regulations. This role involves the preparation, analysis, and filing of various tax returns and reports, playing a crucial part in minimizing tax liabilities while maintaining full compliance across multiple jurisdictions



Key Responsibilities

- Tax Compliance & Reporting: Prepare and submit accurate and timely U.S. federal, state, and local income tax returns and European VAT returns/filings for Yes We Vibe Inc.

- Shopify Sales Tax Report Analysis & Reconciliation: Organize, analyze, and reconcile financial data and accounting records to ensure proper identification and recording of tax liabilities.

- Research & Planning: Conduct in-depth research on new and changing U.S. and European tax laws, trends, and regulations to provide actionable guidance and support tax planning strategies.

Authority Communication: Prepare responses to inquiries and notices from tax authorities including the IRS and various EU tax bodies.

- Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to automate internal flows and improve the efficiency of tax preparation and reporting processes

- Advisory: Advise management on tax strategies and the tax implications of various business decisions and transactions.



Required Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in AccountingProven experience with U.S. and European tax processing and compliance.

- Proven experience with U.S. and European tax processing and complianceProven experience (3+ years preferred) in a tax-focused role with exposure to both U.S. tax preparation and European VAT compliance.

- Proficiency in tax preparation software such TaxJar and Shopify Tax Report.

- Comprehensive understanding of U.S. federal and state tax laws, as well as general EU VAT principles.

- Excellent communication and collaborative abilities

- Looking forward to hearing from you, don’t hesitate if you have any questions. 



JB

title: Google Ads / PPC Specialist
description:
Overview



We are looking for a detail-oriented and results-driven Google Ads / PPC Specialist to plan, manage, and optimize paid advertising campaigns for an event-based business. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of search engine marketing (SEM), analytics, and performance optimization to drive leads, conversions, and measurable ROI.

Key Responsibilities



• Plan, create, and manage PPC campaigns across Google Ads (Search, Display, YouTube) and other relevant platforms

• Conduct keyword research, audience targeting, and competitive analysis to identify growth opportunities

• Write compelling ad copy and run A/B tests to improve click-through and conversion rates

• Monitor and optimize campaigns for performance metrics such as CPC, CPA, ROAS, and Quality Score

• Implement and manage conversion tracking through Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

• Manage campaign budgets effectively to ensure optimal allocation of ad spend

• Generate and present detailed performance reports with insights and recommendations

• Stay up to date with Google Ads updates, algorithm changes, and digital advertising best practices

• Collaborate with creative and marketing teams to ensure alignment of paid campaigns with overall strategy



Qualifications



• 2–4 years of proven experience managing Google Ads or PPC campaigns (agency or in-house)

• Proficiency in Google Ads, GA4, and Tag Manager

• Google Ads Certification preferred

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret campaign data and identify opportunities for improvement

• Experience with A/B testing and conversion rate optimization (CRO)

• Excellent attention to detail, organization, and communication skills

• Ability to manage multiple campaigns and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment



Preferred Skills



• Experience with paid social platforms (Meta Ads, LinkedIn Ads, TikTok Ads)

• Knowledge of remarketing, audience segmentation, and automation strategies

• Understanding of SEO principles to complement SEM campaigns



What We Offer



• Starting rate of $7 per hour, subject to increase after 45 days based on performance

• Competitive salary and performance-based incentives

• Flexible work setup, available as full time or part time

• Opportunities for growth and paid certification support

• Supportive and collaborative marketing environment



How to Apply:



Apply only if you have proven experience with Google Ads and PPC.

Kindly attach your resume and portfolio.



Not following instructions will immediately disqualified.

title: Operations Assistant for US-Owned Coffee Rostery (Turkey Based)
description:
Homestead Coffee Company is a growing coffee roastery and retailer with two physical locations in Turkey. We are looking for a detail-orintated, reliable Operations Assistant to help the American owners stay organized and keep the business running smoothly.



Key Responsibilities:

* Bookkeeping Support: Weekly bank reconciliation and updating P&L reports in Google Docs using our Turkish software, Para?üt (can be managed via Google Translate).

* Vendor Management: Tracking which vendors need to be contacted or paid weekly.

* Payroll Prep: Manually calculating monthly employee shift hours from our system and confirming totals with staff via group chat.

* Social Media: Posting weekly updates/reposts on Instagram.

* Digital Maintenance: Quarterly price updates on Square and delivery apps (Getir); updating digital menus for seasonal drinks.

* Admin/Executive Support: Booking travel, making reservations, and managing the owner's weekly to-do list.

Requirements:

* Extreme Attention to Detail: You will be handling financial data and shift hours where accuracy is critical.

* Tech Savvy: Comfortable using Google Workspace, Square, and using translation tools to navigate non-English software.

* Communication: Excellent English (written and verbal). You will be communicating with some employees who speak English and others via translation.

* Reliability: You are the "right hand" to the owner; we need someone who never misses a weekly report.

* Graphic Design: (Optional/Bonus) Ability to use Canva or similar tools.



Schedule & Compensation:

* Hours: 20 hours per week. We are flexible: either Mon-Fri (4 hrs/day) or Mon-Sat (approx. 3.5 hrs/day).

* Time Zone: We are in Turkey (GMT+3). We will work together to find a crossover window that works for both of us.

* Salary: $275/month.

title: Appointment Setter  – Neutral Accent
description:
APPLY HERE: 



We will not be considering applicants who do not send this through



Pay Range

$800–$2,500 AUD/month, depending on experience, speed, and accuracy

Performance bonuses + leadership growth available after proven consistency





All Direct Plumbing is a Sydney-based plumbing company known for moving faster than anyone else.

We win leads by seconds — literally. Every millisecond counts.



We’re looking for a lightning-fast appointment setter who can click, call, and convert Hipages (and other) leads in record time — under 1 second from notification to acceptance.

You’ll be the first voice customers hear — friendly, confident, not robotic — and the person who turns incoming leads into booked jobs for our plumbing team.



What You’ll Be Doing

- Accept Hipages leads instantly (under 1 second).

- Call the customer within 3 seconds of accepting the job.

- Qualify the lead fast — figure out if it’s urgent, real, and worth sending a plumber.

- Book the job and enter all details in our system accurately (no missing fields).

- Send a friendly SMS confirmation after each booking.

- Work closely with the owner and other lead setters during training.

- Log every job cleanly in our own custom crm/app as well as posting it in whatsapp to the team

- Be flexible — early shifts, Saturdays, and quick changes happen here.



You’ll Fit If You:

- Have a neutral, natural Aussie-style accent (customers can’t tell you’re offshore).

- Can think and react fast under pressure without freezing up.

- Are obsessed with accuracy — zero sloppy data, ever.

- Care about results and don’t need micromanaging.

- Are coachable and improve systems over time.

- Have solid internet, a quiet space, and backup connection.



Non-Negotiables

- You must answer Hipages alerts and click “Accept” within 1 second.

- You must call immediately after accepting.

- You must speak naturally, not like a call centre script.

- You must enter all job info before finishing each shift.

- You must have fast, reliable internet and backup ready.



If you can’t work fast, don’t apply. This is a high-speed role for serious operators only.



Work Hours

- Start: typically 6 AM – 2 PM Sydney time

- Flexibility required for Saturdays or shift changes

- Training: 2–3 weeks shadowing our current setter



How to Apply (Important)

- Complete our Lightning Setter Application Quiz

Applications missing these steps are deleted instantly.



Why You’ll Love This Role

- You’ll be part of a fast-moving, no-nonsense team.

- You’ll learn real sales and operations systems used by top Aussie service companies.

- You’ll see your work turn directly into booked jobs and income every day.

- If you’re great, we’ll build a team around you.

title: [QTR-VA-0047] Virtual Assistant
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines-based applicants only)

Schedule: Full-time | Graveyard Shift

Salary: $700 USD per month



About Us



Quantara AI is a fast-growing artificial intelligence company focused on building intelligent digital products that enhance personalization, automation, and decision-making. We combine AI innovation with efficient systems to support scalable growth.



We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support daily operations and help keep our remote team organized.



Job Responsibilities



1. Administrative Support

- Manage calendars, meetings, and schedules

- Organize documents, trackers, and internal files

- Assist with
 management and follow-ups

- Prepare reports and simple documentation



2. Operations & Coordination

- Maintain spreadsheets, databases, and CRM updates

- Help organize workflows and internal systems



3. Research & Communication

- Conduct online research as needed

- Draft internal messages and basic client responses

- Coordinate with tea
mbers to ensure tasks are completed



4. Content & Social Media Assistance (Light Support)

Requirements

- Strong written English communication skills

Bonus Skills (Not Required)

How to Apply



To be considered, please complete this application form:

title: Video Editor & Graphic Designer
description:
The ideal candidate will:

*Show competency in videography principles from scripting through final editing and show proficiency with branding guidelines using Adobe CS and video motion software such as Premier Pro, Motion, and/or After Effects, Premiere and Final Cut Pro in an Apple Mac environment.

*Pre-visualize and/or storyboard shot ideas based on scripts or project outlines.

*Perform non-linear editing using Final Cut or Adobe Premiere software and designs after effects as needed including motion graphics, layout, and animation

*Be able to select and use music to match the tone and style of the episode and story

*Be able to create various types of audio / video to tell stories across multiple platforms

*Be able to mix different media into a complete experience (video, graphics, music).

*Experience in typography, color, composition, compositing, key framing, and title design.

*Be detail-oriented and possess a sophisticated editing style

*Knowledge of social media and how to engage audiences on digital platforms in the public space is essential to this role

*Ability to work with a team directly in edit sessions to assess needs and meet project requirements.

*Properly maintain a digital archive

*Possess a strong attention to detail and time managements skills, and be an organized team player

*Have experience working in a fast-paced environment on weekly deadlines

*Demonstrate a solid typing WPM (ideally 45 wpm+)

*provide their own video and audio equipment



Job responsibilities include:

*Advise and coach the team on lighting, audio and video requirements to ensure quality footage for use in post-production

*Manage our podcast production schedule for Rosie Radio, including managing workflow; and capture, editing, and uploading of podcasts to various online channels (iTunes [Libsyn], YouTube, blog, etc)

*Play a highly collaborative creative role in structuring new ideas and managing production projects to completion

*Edit online content for YouTube and 
, including podcast episodes, storytelling videos, and how-to videos

*Create and produce marketing videos and PR videos, as needed

*Sourcing photos, stock video and audio as needed for projects

*Create all multimedia content for social (audio / video / design)

*Edit and upload footage and maintain video logs and media storage

*Create motion graphics for video

*Design online / social graphics for various projects



Qualifications

*Well-versed in Adobe Premiere, along with the rest of Adobe CC software (After Effects, Photoshop, etc)

*Experience creating media for social and the web

*Experience in storytelling via videography

*Knowledge of video codecs and encoding software

*Expertise with multicam editing

*A strong understanding of editing workflows and file structuring

*Ability to color correct and mix audio

*Knowledge and experience with video lighting and basic set setup



Tech Requirements:

Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

Need to have professional editing software (Licensed Adobe Premiere)



Work core hours are from Sunday - Thursday 3PM - 7PM CST // Monday - Friday 5AM - 9AM PH Time



This is a PART-TIME role with a salary range of PHP28,000 -38,000 monthly,



Application Instruction:

Fill out this form: 
/appqNAvkEQ10YFlc3/pagnnlBbUosheImMK/form

title: Lead Sourcing Virtual Assistant | Affiliate & Creator Recruiting
description:
We're hiring a **Lead Sourcing Virtual Assistant** to help us find and pre-qualify candidates for our **Affiliate Manager** role.



This is a **focused sourcing and lead generation role**, not a general VA, admin, or customer support job.



Your job is to:



* Find qualified candidates

* Send outreach messages using exact scripts

* Route qualified candidates to an application form



If you are detail-oriented, comfortable with outreach, and can follow instructions precisely, this role is a strong fit.



---



## Responsibilities (Daily Tasks)



* Source candidates using:



  *
 groups (affiliate marketing, CPA marketing, creator marketing)

  *
 / X (affiliate and creator accounts)

  * 
 servers (#jobs / #opportunities channels)

* Send outbound DMs using **provided scripts only**

* Post approved job messages in relevant groups

* Respond to inbound messages using scripts

* Confirm basic candidate qualifications

* Share the official application link with qualified candidates only

* Track outreach and responses in a Google Sheet

* Submit a short daily report



---



## Important: What You Will NOT Do



* x No interviewing

* x No explaining the role in your own words

* x No negotiating compensation

* x No changing scripts

* x No hiring decisions



---



## Required Skills & Experience



* Excellent written English (professional and clear)

* Experience as a:



  * Lead Generation VA

  * Recruiting VA

  * Sourcing VA

  * Outreach VA

* Comfortable sending direct messages (DMs)

* Strong attention to detail

* Ability to follow step-by-step instructions

* Reliable internet and consistent availability



---



## Compensation (Performance-Based)



* **$100 USD per week base pay**

  * Base pay is **only paid if you pass the weekly performance review**



* **$250 USD bonus per successfully hired Affiliate Manager**

  * Bonus is paid only after a candidate is fully hired and onboarded



There is **no limit** to how many bonuses you can earn.



---



## Schedule & Commitment



* Part-time, remote

* Approximately **20–30 hours per week**

* Long-term opportunity for high performers



---



## Performance Expectations



In your **first week**, you should be able to:



* Join relevant sourcing channels

* Send 100+ outreach messages

* Generate qualified application submissions

* Follow scripts with zero deviations



---



## How to Apply (Required)



To apply, you **must** include all of the following:



1. A short paragraph describing your **previous sourcing or lead generation experience**

2. The platforms you have experience with 
,
/X, 
)

3. An example of an **outreach DM or message** you have sent before

4. Your answer to this question:



   > **Are you comfortable following strict scripts and rejecting candidates who do not meet requirements? (Yes / No)**



Applications that do not follow these instructions will **not** be reviewed.



---



## Who This Role Is Best For



This role is ideal for VAs who:



* Have worked in lead generation or recruiting

* Prefer clear rules and structure

* Are comfortable with repetitive outreach

* Understand that **accuracy and compliance matter more than volume**



If you are looking for a creative or flexible VA role, this position is not a fit.

title: EXPERIENCED GENERAL VIRTUAL ASSISTANT
description:
About Dreambound Inc.



Dreambound Inc. is a platform dedicated to facilitating upward mobility in America. Our mission is to help prospective students find the right educational programs across Healthcare, Technology, Business, and Trade and Industry so they can achieve their career goals. We connect students with 300+ schools, offer personalized coaching, and provide the support needed to take charge of their future. We are a fast-paced, mission-driven team committed to making education accessible and impactful.





The Opportunity

We are seeking a highly organized, experienced, and versatile General Virtual Assistant (VA) to join our team.

This role is best suited for a seasoned professional who thrives in dynamic environments, can manage multiple priorities independently, and brings a strong track record of administrative and operational support. You should be a proactive self-starter with excellent organizational skills, high accuracy, and the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new tools and systems.





This is a full-time, long-term role (40 hours per week).

Please use the code DreamTeam when applying through the link below.





Key Responsibilities

- Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

- Provide administrative and organizational support across multiple teams and stakeholders.

- Handle evolving assignments and projects with minimal supervision.

- Anticipate needs, take initiative, and contribute to process improvement and problem-solving.

- Conduct internet research and data collection to support strategic initiatives.

- Maintain accurate and organized records in internal databases and spreadsheets.

- Support tasks related to lead generation, demand generation, and basic SEO maintenance.





Requirements

- Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant, Executive Assistant, Operations Assistant, or similar role.

- Full-time availability (40 hours per week) with no other work commitments.

- Ability to work during Philippine day shift hours.

- Exceptional attention to detail and ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

- High level of autonomy, accountability, and problem-solving skills.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

- Comfortable working with spreadsheets, databases, and productivity tools.





Highly Valued



- Experience with Demand Generation or Marketing Operations workflows.

- Familiarity with SaaS tools, technical workflows, or basic troubleshooting.

- Experience using CRM platforms and automation tools

- Advanced spreadsheet skills (VLOOKUP, QUERY, INDEX/MATCH, automation workflows).

- SEO experience, including basic on-page optimization, keyword research, content updates, and maintaining SEO best practices across pages or databases.

- AI-forward mindset and experience, including working with AI tools to improve efficiency, research quality, documentation, automation, or operational workflows. Comfort experimenting with new AI tools and integrating them into day-to-day work is a strong plus.





Apply



We only accept applications via this link: https://forms.gle/SuxUa6ZnTXHgVUQx6

title: Video Editor Wanted – Cinematic, Movie-Level Style (Final Cut Pro / CapCut)
description:
We’re The Cultivator, an Australian-based agency scaling local and high-ticket service businesses across Australia, the US, and beyond.



If you are interested to apply, please use this link, it will allow you to upload your cv and book an interview call with our team: thecultivator.co/applynow (please select the option for 'content creator' when you say preferred role)

We have a team in the Philippines who will look after you, and conduct the inteview in Tagalog if you would like!



We're on the hunt for a skilled video editor who does it the old-fashioned way.



That means no TikTok voiceovers, no goofy overlays, and definitely no cringe transitions.



We want cinematic storytelling, long-form or short, that feels like a film.



What we’re looking for:

Pro editor in Final Cut Pro or CapCut

Strong portfolio of cinematic edits (think trailers, documentaries, dramatic sequences)

Sharp eye for pacing, tone, and emotion

Ability to handle sound design, light grading, and basic motion if needed

Someone who can build mood and narrative, not just string clips together



Bonus:

Experience editing podcasts, brand storytelling, or personal brand content with a film-like finish

Understanding of modern content formats without sacrificing storytelling



This is not the job for someone who wants to add subtitles in Comic Sans or throw in jump cuts every 3 seconds.

We want smooth, clean, emotionally driven edits that make people feel something.



If that’s you, send your portfolio and a short note to 



Note:

You must have a powerful laptop or desktop computer, a stable wifi connection (for large file downloads) and also a large hard drive (or internal drive) to store the content. You also need skills in handbrake.



Note: Ideally we will be in the 5-8 aud/hr wage.

title: Google Ads Specialist Consultant
description:
Google Ads Specialist (Remote – Project Based)

Location: Remote / Flexible

Type: Part-Time

Reports to: Marketing Head & CEO

Application Link:





About Promofect

Promofect provides custom apparel, promotional products, and branded merchandise for schools, corporations, first responders, nonprofits, and events. As our paid advertising efforts expand across multiple brands and services, we are seeking a skilled Google Ads Specialist to manage, optimize, and improve our paid search campaigns, with a strong focus on lead quality, efficiency, and long-term performance.

This is a part-time, long-term role for someone who understands how paid search fits into a broader marketing ecosystem and can collaborate effectively with SEO and operations.



Why This Role Matters

Drives high-intent traffic for custom apparel and promotional product campaigns

Aligns paid search strategy with organic SEO efforts for stronger overall performance

Improves lead quality while controlling cost per lead

Reduces wasted ad spend through ongoing optimization

Supports predictable growth through scalable paid media systems



Role Overview



We are seeking an experienced Google Ads Consultant to conduct a full audit of our current Google Ads account, evaluate performance, and provide clear recommendations for improvement.



This role is project-based and focused on analysis and strategy. Additional hours may be approved to implement and optimize campaigns based on findings.



Responsibilities

Audit cthe urrent Google Ads setup and campaign structure

Review keywords, targeting, bidding strategy, and budgets

Evaluate ad copy, landing page alignment, and Quality Score

Assess conversion tracking accuracy

Identify wasted spend and performance gaps

Provide a structured audit report with actionable recommendations



Qualifications

3+ years of hands-on Google Ads experience

Strong understanding of paid search optimization and conversion tracking

Proven ability to improve lead quality and reduce cost per lead

title: Senior Bookkeeper – Canadian Property Management Company (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
About Us

We are a growing Canadian property management and renovations company based in Newfoundland, Canada. We manage a portfolio of long-term rental and short-term (Airbnb) properties and are expanding fast. We are a small, tight-knit team that values accuracy, reliability, and someone who takes ownership of their work. We believe in building long-term working relationships — if you're the right person, this is a role you can grow with us.



About the Role

We are looking for an experienced, detail-oriented Senior Bookkeeper to join our team remotely. You will be the financial backbone of our operations — keeping our books clean, organized, and accountant-ready at all times. You will work closely with our Canadian accountant, who will supervise and guide you, so you are never working alone.

This is a full-time position working Newfoundland Standard Time (NST) business hours.



What You'll Be Doing



-Cleaning up and organizing our books from the first two months of operations as your first priority

-Processing biweekly payroll through QuickBooks

-Reconciling all bank accounts weekly across two divisions (property management and renovations)

-Reconciling Airbnb payouts and cleaner payments weekly

-Reconciling rental income and owner disbursements in DoorLoop (our property management software)

-Processing weekly bill payments

-Collecting all expense receipts and following up with tea
mbers who haven't submitted theirs

-Preparing monthly owner statements and disbursing funds to landlords

-Tracking renovation project costs by job and flagging overruns

-Preparing monthly P&L summaries for both divisions

-Compiling HST/GST working papers for the accountant monthly

-Preparing quarterly financial packages and year-end working papers

-Supporting annual budgeting with historical financial data





What We're Looking For



-5+ years of bookkeeping experience, ideally with exposure to property management or construction/renovations

-Proficient in QuickBooks — you can run payroll and reconcile accounts confidently

-Experience with DoorLoop or similar property management software is a strong plus

-Solid understanding of Canadian accounting practices and CRA requirements is an advantage but not required — our accountant will guide you

-Strong attention to detail — you catch errors before they become problems

-Proactive communicator — you follow up, you flag issues early, and you don't let things fall through the cracks

-Reliable, self-directed, and comfortable working independently during Canadian business hours

-Excellent written English





What We Offer



-40,000Php – 60,000Php/month depending on experience

-Stable, full-time remote work with a growing Canadian company

-Direct supervision and support from a Canadian accountant — you will always have guidance

-A role with real responsibility and room to grow as our portfolio expands

-Consistent hours aligned with Newfoundland business hours 





How to Apply



Please apply with the following:



-Your updated resume

-A brief cover letter telling us about your bookkeeping experience and any property management or construction accounting background you have

-Your QuickBooks experience level, property management software experience and any certifications you hold



Applications without a cover letter will not be reviewed. We are looking for someone who pays attention to detail from the very first step.



This role is ideal for a seasoned bookkeeper who wants a stable, long-term remote position with a supportive team. If that sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Marketing Operations Manager
description:
Marketing Operations Manager 



Type: Full-time, Remote

Working Hours: Singapore/Philippines Time

Reports to: Founder / COO





About Us



We are Singapore’s fastest growing performance marketing, education, and software company.



We help speakers, coaches, consultants, and service-based business owners:



- Fill paid events

- Scale marketing campaigns

- Build predictable lead systems

- Deliver strong client results through education, services, and software



Our business includes:



- Multiple live & virtual events every year

- Ongoing marketing campaigns across funnels

- A growing software + AI ecosystem with active clients



We move fast, run many parallel initiatives, and operate in a high-accountability environment.



We are now hiring a senior Operations Manager to act as the execution backbone of the company.



About the Role (Read Carefully)



This is not an assistant role.

This is not a coordination-only role.



As Operations Manager, you are the central execution owner of the business.



Your job is to:



- Translate priorities into execution

- Enforce deadlines

- Drive accountability

- Ensure events, marketing, and software operations run smoothly

- Reduce founder involvement in day-to-day execution



If something is delayed, unclear, or broken — you own fixing it.



Core Responsibilities

???? 1. Events Operations (Live & Virtual)



We run multiple paid events such as bootcamps, workshops, implementation sprints, and masterminds.



You own end-to-end operational execution of every event.



What This Includes:



- Planning & Timelines

- Build complete event execution plans in Asana

- Break events into phases: pre-event, marketing, event day, post-event

- Assign owners, set deadlines, and enforce follow-ups

- Ensure no assumptions, no missed dependencies



Marketing Coordination (Pre-Event)



- Coordinate copywriters, designers, video editors, tech team, and media buyers

- Ensure event funnels,
 sequences, WhatsApp reminders, and ad creatives are produced and launched on time

- Track registrations, attendance, and cost per lead (CPL)

- Flag performance issues early and work with the team to improve results



Tech & Systems



- Ensure registration flows, payment links, and automations work correctly

- Set up and test Zoom / webinar / streaming links (including backups)

- Ensure recordings, attendance tracking, and follow-up systems are ready

- Personally test critical flows before the event



Event-Day Execution



- Act as the behind-the-scenes execution lead

- Keep the event running on schedule

- Resolve tech, logistics, or team issues calmly and decisively

- Allow the founder to focus purely on delivery



Post-Event Follow-Up



- Ensure recordings and materials are delivered

- Coordinate feedback collection and internal debriefs

- Document improvements so each event runs better than the last



???? 2. Marketing Operations (Campaign Execution)



We run ongoing marketing campaigns across multiple funnels.



You do not need to write copy or run ads — but you own execution quality and timelines.



Responsibilities:



- Translate campaign plans into clear Asana tasks

- Delegate work to copywriters, designers, video editors, tech staff, and media buyers

- Ensure deliverables are completed on time and to standard



Track key metrics such as:



- Launch readiness

- Funnel performance

- Cost per lead (CPL)



Flag issues early and coordinate improvements with:



- Copy (messaging angles)

- Creatives (visual hooks)

- Media buyers (testing and optimisation)



Your role is to ensure campaigns run properly, not to execute them yourself.



???? 3. Software, Retention & Customer Success Operations



We operate software and AI tools used by paying clients.



You own customer success execution and operational quality.



Responsibilities:



- Ensure client queries are answered on time and professionally

- Coordinate tech, support, and success teams to resolve issues

- Oversee onboarding, retention, and activation workflows

- Track client engagement, satisfaction, and churn risks

- Coordinate projects to improve client results

- Support new feature and AI tool launches operationally



Ensure clients:



- Get results

- Stay engaged

- Trust the company

- Continue using and upgrading our products



This role requires thinking in systems, not just tickets.



???? 4. Accountability, Deadlines & Team Execution



- Own daily and weekly execution across teams

- Enforce deadlines using Asana

- Follow up relentlessly until work is completed and signed off

- Escalate issues early when standards are not met

title: Field Operations Manager (AU/NZ Market Research)
description:
Job Title: Field Operations Manager (AU/NZ Market Research)



Are you a high-level operations expert who thrives on managing complex logistics and leading remote teams?

TKW Research Group is seeking a results-driven Field Operations Manager to act as the "command Centre" for our national face-to-face data collection operations across Australia and New Zealand. Reporting directly to our CEO and General Manager, you will lead the end-to-end management of large-scale field projects—from recruitment and training to real-time troubleshooting.



This is not a typical Virtual Assistant role; it is an "all-rounder" leadership position designed for a professional who excels at people management and operational oversight in a fast-paced environment.

The Role: What You’ll Be Doing



Workforce Leadership: Manage a geographically dispersed team of field interviewers across various metropolitan areas in Australia and New Zealand.



Operational Oversight: Direct all in-person data collection, including project logistics, complex scheduling, and resource allocation to meet strict client deadlines.



Real-Time Problem Solving: Act as the primary technical and operational support for staff in the field, resolving issues with tablet devices and survey software on the fly.



Quality & Performance: Monitor performance in real-time to ensure benchmarks are met and data validity follows ISO 20252:2019 standards.



Strategic Growth: Collaborate with the executive team to identify new business opportunities and scale the division into new territories.



Who You Are



Exceptional Communicator: You possess "top shelf" written and spoken English, capable of coordinating with high-level stakeholders and international teams.



Proven Leader: You have significant experience managing remote or geographically dispersed workforces.



Logistics Expert: You have a "problem-solving mindset" and can handle shifting priorities, complex rosters, and unpredictable field variables like a pro.



Tech-Savvy: You are highly proficient with mobile devices (Android/iOS) and project management tools.



Position Details & Benefits



Location: Fully Remote (Philippines-based).



Hours: Flexibility is required to match Australian/NZ time zones (e.g., early starts); the role operates 7 days a week during active field periods.



Compensation: Up to USD 12.50 per hour, depending on skill level and demonstrated experience (reviewed after 6 months).



Support & Scaling: You will receive direct training from the CEO and GM. Once you are proficient and autonomous, we will employ a Virtual Assistant to support you, allowing you to focus on strategic division growth.



How to Apply (Phase 1)



To ensure you have a high attention to detail, please follow these instructions carefully: 



1. Send your resume and a brief cover letter 

2. Use the Subject Line: Field Manager - Melbourne

3. Include a brief paragraph (max 100 words) explaining your experience managing remote teams.



Note: Applications that do not follow the subject line instruction will not be considered.

title: Moodle Developer — Custom Plugin (Report / Lesson Tracker)
description:
Job Title: Moodle Developer — Custom Plugin (Report / Lesson Tracker)

Project Type: Short-term contract (initial build), potential ongoing work

Platform: Moodle 4.5.6 (Theme: Lambda)

Rate: ~$300(fixed milestone preferred)

Estimated Effort: 10–16 hours



Overview

We are building a custom Moodle feature for a tutoring platform that replaces Google Sheets tracking with an integrated in-course “Report / Lesson Tracker.”

The system will sit inside each course and allow tutors and students to track lesson activity, homework status, notes, and reflections in one structured monthly view.

This is a local plugin build — not a theme redesign and not a core Moodle modification.

A detailed product brief, data model, UI structure, and starter code scaffold are already prepared.



This role focuses on implementation, wiring, testing, and deployment inside Moodle — not product discovery.

title: Industrial/Product Designer for Consumer Products - Full Time, Remote
description:
About the Role

We’re looking for a highly creative Industrial Designer based in the Philippines to help define and evolve the visual identity of our product portfolio across high-end hair tools and power/home improvement tools.

This role focuses on product form, brand expression, CMF, and user experience. You will translate brand strategy into iconic, emotionally compelling physical products that stand out in competitive global markets.

From premium hair dryers to precision power tools, you will shape a cohesive and recognizable design language that defines who we are — while working closely with our product development team to ensure your vision is thoughtfully executed.

?

Responsibilities

• Lead the form development and aesthetic direction of new products across multiple categories.

• Create a distinctive and consistent design language that strengthens brand recognition.

• Explore concepts through sketching, form studies, ergonomic refinement, and 3D development.

• Develop thoughtful CMF (Color, Material, Finish) strategies aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure designs consider real-world functionality, usability, and internal component integration.

• Collaborate closely with the product development team to align on feasibility, performance requirements, and manufacturing considerations while maintaining design integrity.

• Produce high-quality renderings and presentation visuals to communicate design intent.

• Conduct trend research and competitive analysis to inform forward-thinking design decisions.

• Contribute to a cohesive product ecosystem across SKUs and categories.



What We’re Looking For

• Strong portfolio demonstrating brand-led product design, form exploration, and CMF expertise.

• Experience designing consumer products (beauty, electronics, tools, home goods, lifestyle products, etc.).

• Exceptional understanding of proportion, ergonomics, surface development, and user interaction.

• Ability to balance aesthetics, functionality, and manufacturability.

• Strong sketching skills (digital or hand).

• Proficiency in 3D modeling and rendering tools such as Rhino, SolidWorks, Fusion 360, KeyShot, or similar.

• Clear communication skills and experience collaborating with cross-functional teams.



What you'll get

Competitive Salary – Earn in USD!

Health Coverage (HMO) – Enjoy peace of mind after one year!

Paid Time Off – Because work-life balance matters!



How to Apply

Please submit your portfolio showcasing concept sketches, form development, CMF exploration, and final product renderings.

We’re looking for designers who create products people recognize instantly — before they even see the logo.



To move forward, please answer the following questions:

*Job Preferences:

Are you comfortable working on graveyard shift, 40hrs/wk?

What is your current salary?

What is your expected salary (in USD, per hour)?

Are you open to working with a time tracker?

Are you able to provide a contact from your previous employer for character reference?

Are you available to start immediately?



*Industrial/Product Designer Experience

Years of experience as Industrial/Product Designer:

Years of experience in design software such as SolidWorks or AutoCAD

Years of experience in designing for plastic, metal, and other relevant materials:

Years of experience in industrial/product design, (consumer electronics and home improvement tools):

Link your portfolio here:

Have you handled DTC/ecommerce?:

Have you worked before with US clients?:



Additionally, please share a link to your resume and portfolio/past work highlighting your relevant experience in this role.

title: Industrial Designer
description:
Mid-level industrial designer with one or more of the skill sets below.

4 to 10 years’ experience (Not an entry-level role)



*** THIS IS NOT AN ENGINEERING POSITION ***



1: Industrial Design Fundamentals

Drawing skills are essential  - example (
)

Form development and product aesthetics

User-focused design and basic ergonomics

Clear concept development through sketching (digital or hand)

Understanding of materials, manufacturing methods, and assembly

Ability to iterate based on feedback and constraints



2: Industrial Design Computer Modeling

3D modeling in SolidWorks or Fusion 360

Clean, organized conceptual CAD suitable for engineering handoff

Basic understanding of tolerances and part breakdown

Experience supporting design-for-manufacture

Ability to revise models quickly and accurately



3: Visualization + Communication

Create clear presentation visuals for reviews and clients

Basic to intermediate rendering capability

Produce exploded views, callouts, and diagrams

Communicate design intent clearly through visuals

Support internal documentation and presentations



How This Work Is Structured

Remote work

Use your own computer and software 

Report to Design Director for direction and questions

Meetings early US central time (late to midnight Philippine time)

You will be assigned tasks and deadlines

Work from defined briefs with periodic feedback



What We’re Looking For

Creatives who express their ideas through hand drawing

Mid-level designers with real product experience

People who can execute without constant supervision

Clear communicators who respond well to feedback



About KAIA



KAIA is an Emmy-winning creative agency working at the intersection of design, engineering, and storytelling. Our work spans a wide range of project types and industries, with engagements that vary in scope and depth—from early-stage concept development to detailed, production-ready solutions. This variety is intentional; KAIA does not operate from a single template or repeat the same approach across clients. Each project introduces new constraints, users, and technical challenges.



The studio emphasizes practical problem solving over surface-level aesthetics. Design at KAIA extends beyond sketches and visuals into engineering-informed decisions, technical refinement, and execution that supports manufacturing and real-world deployment. The work is professional, high-end, and grounded in outcomes that matter.



KAIA operates as a small, experienced team that prioritizes clarity, accountability, and quality over scale. We partner selectively with clients and focus on work where thoughtful design and technical rigor create measurable value.



* response requires a resume and a portfolio *

title: Social Media Manager - Long Term Employment US (Real Estate)
description:
We’re hiring a growth-minded Social Media Manager in the Philippines to support our top-producing luxury real estate team in San Francisco, CA, U.S. You must have a dedicated workspace free from distractions and be available from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. PST.



This is a long-term role for someone who wants to do high-quality work in a fast-moving, high-performing team. We operate with clear standards, strong communication, and a lot of trust. We move quickly, support each other, and focus on results — not just staying busy.



If you’re someone who takes ownership of your work, isn’t afraid to share your experience, give your opinion, or ask questions when you need clarity, and enjoys being part of a fast-paced team of A-players, you’ll fit in well here.



ABOUT US 



We are the Krishnan Team, one of the Top 3 real estate teams in San Francisco, with over $1 billion in closed sales since 2009. We believe strong results come from smart systems and people who care about doing things well. Our culture is built around:



-Fairness

-Accountability

-Continuous learning

-Collaboration

WHAT YOU'LL DO

We’re looking for someone who thinks clearly, executes consistently, communicates openly, and isn’t afraid to speak up or share their ideas. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys contributing in a fast-moving, high-standard environment and wants their work to make a real impact.



You’ll have clear direction and expectations, and you’ll be trusted to manage your responsibilities and improve how things are done.



DAY TO DAY

ANALYTICS & SYSTEMS

SKILL AND EXPEREINCE

-Understanding of social media SEO and keyword usage

-Comfortable using Instagram, Canva, CapCut, Google Workspace, Asana, ManyChat, and Later

-Experience with U.S. clients is a plus

-Experience with real estate or luxury brands is a bonus



Ideally, you are familiar with or can quickly learn…



-Google Suite of Services

-Instagram,

-Canva

-LLMs

-Scheduling tools like Later

-Editing software like Capcut, Adobe Premiere Pro, or Final Cut Pro

-Project management tool like Asana



THE DETAILS

-Salary: $1000-$1800 USD a month (including bonuses), commensurate with qualifications and experience.

NOTE: Exceptional candidates with extensive expertise and a proven track record may be considered for a higher compensation package.

-Benefits: Paid Time Off

-Hours: Full-time 40+ hours

-Location: Remote. This position is open to candidates residing in the Philippines only.

-(Office is based in San Francisco, CA) You must have a dedicated workspace free from distractions and be available from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. PST.



TOOLS

-RAM: 8 GB and above

-GPU: 2GB and above

-Headset

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: AI Systems Engineer (Claude-Centered Research Systems)
description:
AI Systems Engineer (Claude-Centered Research Systems)



Overview



Upside Auction is building a structured AI infrastructure to power real estate auction intelligence at scale as we expand into more states and properties.



We are seeking our first dedicated AI Systems Engineer / AI Engineer to architect and implement a Claude-centered research system that automates:



1. Foreclosure and lien research

2. Title and legal document analysis

3. Court notice and deed parsing

4. Property-level research and information gathering

5. CRM and workflow automation tied to AVP and HubSpot



We are looking for a builder who can design, deploy, and operationalize real-world LLM systems inside a production workflow, with hands-on implementation, setup, and virtual environment deployment experience.



Anthropic Claude will serve as the central orchestration layer (“bot manager”) for research and decision-support processes, coordinating AI agents to perform tasks.



What You’ll Build



You will design and deploy a scalable AI research infrastructure that:



1. Acts as an internal AI research assistant for property and auction data

2. Automates foreclosure, lien, and broader legal/title research workflows

3. Coordinates AI agents to:

   3.1 Retrieve documents from multiple external sites and tools

   3.2 Summarize and validate results

   3.3 Flag mismatches (e.g., wrong document numbers, wrong property)

4. Parses and extracts structured data from:

   4.1 Court filings and notices

   4.2 Notices of sale

   4.3 Deeds and title documents

   4.4 Legal PDFs and scanned documents

5. Integrates directly with:

   5.1 Internal data sources and research tools

   5.2 AVP workflows

   5.3 HubSpot CRM

6. Maintains structured logs, audit trails, and validation checks so humans can quickly review and correct edge cases

7. Optimizes cost and performance of LLM usage as we scale to hundreds of properties



You will help move Upside Auction from manual, research-heavy workflows (multiple people, many minutes per property) to structured, AI-assisted research systems.



Key Responsibilities



1. Architect Claude-centered LLM workflows for legal/property research and document handling

2. Design system prompts and multi-step reasoning chains for:

   2.1 Document retrieval

   2.2 Structured extraction

   2.3 Validation and error detection

3. Build document parsing pipelines (PDF, OCR, text extraction, structured output)

4. Implement:

   4.1 Error handling and retry logic

   4.2 Validation layers to catch issues like mis-labeled or mis-indexed documents

   4.3 Task feedback loops between AI agents and the Claude “manager” bot

5. Deploy and maintain services in virtual/cloud environments (virtual terminals/VMs)

6. Integrate LLM outputs into:

   6.1 HubSpot CRM workflows

   6.2 AVP and internal automation systems

   6.3 Internal folders and knowledge repositories

7. Implement monitoring, logging, and cost tracking for AI usage

8. Document:

   8.1 System architecture

   8.2 Installation and configuration steps (virtual terminals/environments)

   8.3 Operational playbooks for non-technical tea
mbers

9. Work directly with leadership and research staff to translate current manual research processes into robust AI-powered workflows



You will own this function end-to-end and will be building this as a fresh project.



Required Skills & Experience



1. Production experience implementing Anthropic Claude (real workflows, not demos)

2. Experience with OpenAI GPT/Codex or comparable LLM APIs

3. Proven ability to design and ship production systems independently

4. Strong skills in Python (preferred) or JavaScript/TypeScript

5. Comfortable with Linux, virtual environments, and cloud/VM deployment

6. Experience building API integrations and document processing pipelines (PDF/OCR/structured extraction)

7. Working knowledge of databases and structured data modeling

8. Ability to translate manual business processes into automated, agent-driven workflows

9. Clear technical documentation and communication skills



Nice-to-Have



1. Experience designing agentic or multi-step LLM systems

2. Familiarity with RAG, vector databases, or retrieval systems

3. Experience integrating with HubSpot or similar CRMs

4. Exposure to LLMOps / monitoring / prompt versioning

5. Background in real estate, foreclosure, title, or legal-tech workflows

6. Startup experience with full ownership of systems



Send us your resume and portfolio to apply.

title: ResMan Expert
description:
Job Overview

We are looking for a ResMan Expert to serve as our primary software monitor and system administrator. Your main priority is to ensure the ResMan platform is accurately maintained, monitored daily, and utilized to its full potential. In addition to system oversight, you will provide administrative support and assist in creating marketing materials to showcase project progress.



Key Responsibilities

1. ResMan System Monitoring & Management



Active Monitoring: Perform daily audits of the ResMan platform to ensure all project data, vendor details, and cost entries are current.



Log Maintenance: Maintain and update digital RFI and Submittal logs within ResMan with 100?curacy.



Data Entry & Integrity: Input critical project information and vendor details, ensuring no errors in financial or project tracking.



Reporting: Pull data from ResMan to generate weekly and monthly status reports regarding project health and upcoming milestones.



Qualifications & Tools

ResMan Expertise: Extensive experience monitoring and managing data within the ResMan Property management software.



Communication: Fluent, professional English (verbal and written) with a neutral accent for phone calls and video meetings.



Technical Proficiency: * Expert Level: ResMan, Microsoft 360 (Excel, OneDrive, Teams).
