title: Property & Construction Accounting Analyst
description:
Property & Construction Accounting Analyst



Upside Capital Holdings



Rate: $10-$13/hour



Schedule: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST



Work Setup: Fully Remote



About the Role



The Property & Construction Accounting Analyst will support the accounting needs of Upside Capital Holdings across our residential construction projects and multifamily real estate portfolio. This role includes budget assistance, payroll allocation, intercompany reconciliations, bank reconciliations, and general accounting functions for various US-based entities.



Key Responsibilities



Perform daily accounting tasks, journal entries, and month-end close support.

Assist with budget preparation, forecasting, variance tracking, and CapEx cost monitoring.

Manage payroll allocations, distribution logs, and employee record updates.

Prepare and maintain intercompany reconciliation schedules across multiple entities.

Complete monthly bank reconciliations and review cash activity.

Support AP/AR processing, vendor documentation, and invoice management.

Maintain organized digital financial files and provide support for audits or CPA requests.

Prepare reports, spreadsheets, trackers, and financial summaries as needed.



Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance (CPA preferred).

1–3 years of accounting experience handling US-based clients.

Experience in residential construction and/or multifamily real estate accounting is strongly preferred.

QuickBooks Online experience is required.

Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook).

Experience with ResMan or AppFolio is a plus.

Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and organization.

Ability to work independently in a fully remote environment.

title: Experienced Amazon Online Arbitrage Product Researcher
description:
We are hiring an experienced Amazon Online Arbitrage Sourcing VA who lives and breathes Keepa, KPF, SellerAmp, storefront stalking, reverse sourcing, and manual sourcing.



This position is for experienced OA sourcers. If you can confidently analyze products, spot winners fast, and deliver high-quality, low-risk leads, we want you. 



You will be responsible for finding profitable, scalable OA leads using advanced sourcing methods, including:

- Storefront stalking to uncover proven, selling products

- Reverse sourcing (must understand how to validate and scale results)

- Keepa Product Finder for opportunity discovery



You must be able to:



Read Keepa charts:

- Price stability and Buy Box trends

- Competition changes and stock levels

- Sales rank behavior (drops & consistency)



Use SellerAmp expertly:

- Accurate ROI and profit calculations

- Buybox rotation

- IP complaint and brand risk analysis

- Hazmat and variation checks

- Evaluate risk and profitability



When applying, please put "Banana" at the top of your message



You will only be considered if YOU can:

- Clearly identify strong sellers vs risky listings

- Avoid IP complaints and problematic brands

- Analyze competition depth — not just seller count

- Accurately analyze price stability using Keepa

- Deeply understand Amazon fees, ROI, and profit margins

- Work independently with confidence, while remaining coachable and ALWAYS willing to ask questions when unsure to avoid costly mistakes



Required Tools Knowledge:

- Keepa (Advanced - non-negotiable)

- SellerAmp (Advanced - non-negotiable)

- Google sheets

- US online retail stores

- Discounted giftcard sites (Cardbear etc)

- Cash Back and Coupon Extensions



What We Offer:

- Long-term, stable work for the right product researcher

- Competitive pay based on experience and results

- Clear sourcing, guidelines, and support

- Opportunity to grow within a scaling Amazon business



Does this sound like you? Include your favorite color at the end of your application



To Apply Include:

- Your Amazon Online Arbitrage experience (years/months and DETAILED tasks) / Resume

- Explain how you use Keepa and SellerAmp in your daily sourcing

- Your experience with storefront stalking

- How many quality leads you can realistically provide per day/week



In your application, briefly explain how you use Keepa and SellerAmp to determine a good lead vs a bad lead 



Please include:

- Key Keepa signals you look for (sales rank behavior, price stability, competition, etc.)

- Screenshots or supporting documentation showing your analysis



Bonus: Include one example of a lead you would reject and explain why

title: Amazon OA Product Researcher / Sourcer (Industrial Niche)
description:
We are an Amazon eCommerce business focused on Online Arbitrage (OA) in the industrial parts industry, selling OEM and replacement products across categories such as Industrial & Scientific, Tools & Home Improvement, Appliances, Laundry parts, and DIY repair components. Our products support maintenance, repairs, and everyday operational needs for both professional and DIY customers, and we prioritize accurate sourcing, quality listings, and long-term account health through clear systems and organized workflows.



Key Responsibilities

- Source profitable products for Online Arbitrage on Amazon

- Analyze product metrics such as sales rank, pricing history, competition, pineapple and restrictions

- Analyze Keepa and SellerAmp to validate demand, profit margins, and risks

- Track sourced products and maintain organized sourcing records

- Follow sourcing guidelines and business profitability standards

- Communicate regularly with the team regarding sourcing progress and results



Requirements

- Strong attention to detail

- Proven experience in Online Arbitrage sourcing in the industrial niche for Amazon

- Hands-on experience using Keepa and SellerAmp

- Strong understanding of product research fundamentals (ROI, margins, fees, competition, restrictions)

- Strong attention to detail

- Ability to work independently and meet daily/weekly sourcing targets



Benefits

- Stable long term role

- 30,000 PHP per month paid weekly

- Flexible working hours



How to apply

Follow these instructions extremely carefully. This is a test of your attention to detail.

- Send your resume

- At the very top of your cover letter, answer these two questions:

• What’s the hidden fruit in this job post?

• Which bullet in this job post was repeated exactly twice?

title: AI Automation Specialist
description:
Work Hours: Mon-Fri, 20 hours per week. Shift may be required to start as early as 4AM PH Time



About the Firm:

Our immigration law firm specializes in providing expert legal services to individuals, families, and businesses navigating the complexities of U.S. immigration law. We are a dedicated team of professionals committed to delivering top-quality support and guidance to our clients.



Position Overview:

We are seeking a tech-savvy and research-driven AI Automation Specialist to join our growing immigration law firm. This role will focus on identifying, evaluating, and implementing effective AI tools that enhance operational efficiency, improve workflows, and support both legal and administrative functions. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of AI technologies, automation platforms, and legal tech tools, and can translate those into practical, impactful solutions for our remote-work environment.



Other Skills / Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Legal Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

• Demonstrated experience in researching and implementing AI tools or automation platforms (e.g., Zapier, Notion AI, ChatGPT, etc.).

• Familiarity with legal operations or law firm processes is a strong plus.

• Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.

• Excellent communication and documentation skills.

• Detail-oriented, self-motivated, and comfortable working independently in a remote setup.



Duties:

• AI Tools Research & Evaluation:

Conduct research to identify AI-driven solutions (e.g., for document review, scheduling, automation, client communication, etc.) that fit the specific needs of an immigration law practice.

• Implementation Support:

Assist in testing and onboarding selected tools, ensuring smooth integration into existing workflows.

• Process Improvement:

Collaborate with team leaders to map out inefficiencies and recommend AI solutions that improve speed, accuracy, and productivity.

• Training & Documentation:

Create basic training guides and assist with internal rollouts to help tea
mbers understand and adopt AI tools effectively.

• Trend Monitoring:

Stay up-to-date with legal tech innovations, AI regulations, and industry trends to keep the firm competitive and compliant.

• Vendor Coordination:

Liaise with AI tool providers for demos, trials, and troubleshooting.



Department: Marketing

Note: This is an independent contractor position.



Only those applicants who submit their applications on this link will be screened:


/form/

title: Welcome to K-POP Universe : Office Admin Role for E-Commerce ! Join the Beat !
description:
- Recruitment validity period: Until 3 business days from the date of the first recruitment announcement

- A PH VA team of more than 5 people has already been formed, and business collaboration is possible using Tagalog in a comfortable atmosphere.

- Providing educational tutorial videos and operating a mentorship program to help new comers quickly adapt



[About Us]

* Company Introduction (Video):

youtu.be/dO2mWWZANx8



[Join Summitree and Write Your K-POP Legacy Alongside Filipinos]

Summitree envisions leveraging their Filipino employees' intelligence and English fluency to expand globally while sharing their passion for K-POP. They highlight the Philippines' crucial role in their expansion plans, emphasizing collaboration with their Filipino team to make a mark in the K-POP world. Joining Summitree means joining a multicultural team (Korea, Philippines, Mongolia, Others) with a shared goal of making K-POP history.



[Responsibilities]

We are looking for a “Full-Time” Office Admin to handle our business.

You will be doing a variety of tasks, almost all of which we will create tutorials for you.

1. Order fulfillment and shipping label generation

You will be responsible for gathering and processing customer orders accurately and efficiently. This includes coordinating with third-party logistics (3PL) providers for inbound and outbound shipments to ensure smooth operations.

2. Product listing and scheduling

As a distributor of K-POP records and merchandise, you will be involved in registering new products into our system. This includes managing inventory, updating product information, and ensuring accurate data entry. Additionally, you will be responsible for scheduling release dates and managing timelines using tools like Google Calendar.

3. Sales & Marketing

You will be responsible for studying and trying how to gain traffics to our shopping mall. Active working on research articles related to SEO, social marketing and finding where and how to promote our shopping mall is required.

4. Customer service support

providing excellent customer service is crucial to us. You will be responsible for addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction. Your communication skills and problem-solving abilities will play a vital role in maintaining strong relationships with our valued customers.



[Required qualifications & skillset (must have)]

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

* Experience in puchasing K-POP Album or knowledge of K-POP related products (album, merchandise)

* Idea of how to promote K-POP albums and gain traffics in our shopping mall in PH online K-POP community for each artists



[Desired qualifications & skillset (nice to have)]

* Experience in handling customer service

* Experience in Photoshop

* Experience in
 Ads or Google Ads

* Knowledge and Experience of Microsoft Excel & Familar with Using Various Formula

* Experience in experience in Amazon Business (Familiar with Interface and function) or other E-commerce Platform



[Compensation & Employment Terms]

* ONLY Looking for a full time employee

* $300~$400/mo. determined based on the candidate’s skills, experience, and overall evaluation relative to other applicants

* One-year renewable Contract

- Compensation and terms may be adjusted based on attendance, teamwork, and performance.

- Exceptional performers may be considered for early renewal or adjustment. (multiple successful cases)

* 6-month probationary period with possibility of early conversion to regular position based on performance (multiple successful cases)



[Perks & Benefits]

1. Regular Employee Benefits

- 13th Month Salary provided

- 10 additional paid leave days upon regularization

2. Birthday Benefit (After 6 Months of Employment)

- Receive one free K-POP album of your favorite artist on your birthday

3. Paid Holidays (Regardless of Employment Status)

- January 1st (New Year’s Day) and Christmas Day are paid holidays

- Applies to both probationary and regular employees

4. Performance-Based Incentives

- Additional incentives may be provided during high-performance sales periods

(Example: major comeback seasons for artists such as BTS or Stray Kids)

5. Long Service Incentive Program

- 1-Year Service / 3-Year Service / 5-Year Service



[How To Apply for the job]

Just Fill out 10 Simple Questions through Google Form






Interview via google meet will be conducted after first screening and candidates will be notifed to their
s or
 



Thank you



Human Resource Dept.

Summitree

title: Marketing Management Associate
description:
About the Role



We are seeking a proactive and creative Marketing Manager Associate to help drive brand growth and increase revenue through strategic marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience in digital marketing, social media management, and advertising, with the ability to turn insights into engaging campaigns that deliver measurable results.



Key Responsibilities

-Develop and execute effective sales and marketing strategies to boost revenue and brand awareness.

-Track industry trends, competitor activities, and consumer insights to identify growth opportunities.

-Design and manage marketing flyers, social media posts, and promotional materials for digital and offline channels.

-Create and optimize Google and Meta Ads campaigns to maximize reach and conversions.

-Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and execute creative, engaging campaigns aligned with brand objectives.

-Analyze sales data and marketing metrics to evaluate performance and improve strategies.

-Provide exceptional customer support to ensure satisfaction and encourage repeat business.



Requirements

-Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects efficiently.

-Excellent communication and negotiation skills for effective stakeholder engagement.

-Proven strategic thinking, problem-solving, and creativity in developing marketing initiatives.

-Experience with marketing design tools like Canva, social media management, Google Ads, and Meta Ads.

-Proactive attitude with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.





How to Apply

/free-personality-test

.

title: UGC AI Video Editor (AI Avatar Talking Videos)
description:
We are a fast-paced digital performance marketing agency scaling aggressively on Meta 
 & Instagram). We generate a high volume of creative assets daily, and we are looking for a highly organized, efficient, detail-oriented and creative video editor for our campaigns. 



We prioritize in user generated content (UGC) in video form. 



If you do NOT have the following requirements, do NOT apply:

1. Experience with Sora

2. Experience with Gemini and Google Flow

3. Experience making User Generated Content (ex. an AI avatar talking to us)

Video Generation: This will be through us sending you videos to replicate or you creating your own video with our script.

- minimum 6 months of Video Editing and Content Creating experience with background in AI and UGC videos

title: Lead Manager/SMS Coordinator
description:
Lead Manager / SMS Response Coordinator (Real Estate)



Part-Time | Remote (Philippines) | $4–$5/hr | 3–4 Hours per Day



REAL ESTATE EXPERIENCE IS REQUIRED



U.S.-based real estate investment company seeking a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to manage and sort inbound SMS responses from property owners.



We receive approximately 400–500 inbound text responses per day from marketing campaigns. Your responsibility is to carefully review each message, categorize it correctly, and assign qualified leads to the appropriate tea
mber inside our CRM.



Accuracy is critical. Each lead must be handled correctly. Errors can directly impact company revenue.



Responsibilities

Log into SMS platform (Smarter Contact) daily

Review and interpret inbound text responses

Categorize seller intent based on provided guidelines

Transfer qualified leads into the CRM

Assign leads to the correct acquisitions tea
mber

Disqualify and remove irrelevant responses

Flag unique or sensitive situations for management review

Follow SOPs and internal decision processes exactly

Ideal Candidate

Strong attention to detail

Able to process high message volume efficiently

Excellent written English comprehension

Comfortable working independently

Reliable and consistent

Able to follow structured systems without deviation

Not emotionally reactive to negative or hostile responses



Schedule



3–4 hours per day

Monday–Friday (potential weekend hours later)

Must have some overlap with U.S. business hours



Compensation



$4–$5 per hour, based on experience

Long-term opportunity for growth into expanded roles



Application Instructions



Please include the following in your application:

A brief description of a role where attention to detail was essential.

Your method for avoiding mistakes during repetitive tasks.

What you would do if you were unsure how to categorize a message.

Your internet speed and backup plan for outages.

Your availability during U.S. hours.

Have you worked real estate before? Ae you familiar with x leads, go high level, smarter contact?

title: TikTok Shop & Paid Social Growth Manager (US Market)
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Company: Third Shift

Hours: Full-time (40 hrs/week)

Compensation: Competitive base + performance bonus tied to GMV growth



About Third Shift - 

Third Shift is a US hair and body care brand built for busy women. We create time-saving, functional products. Our philosophy: Time is Power. We’ve recently launched and are scaling aggressively across TikTok Shop, Shopify, and Instagram. We are hiring someone who can OWN growth.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a TikTok Shop & Paid Social Growth Manager who can manage and scale:

- TikTok Shop (organic + affiliate)

- TikTok Ads (conversion-focused)

- Meta Ads (retargeting + scaling)

- Shopify performance optimization



This is a revenue role. You will be measured on growth.



Core Responsibilities: 



TikTok Shop Management

- Optimize product listings (SEO, keywords, bundles)

- Run flash sales, campaigns, promotions

- Monitor GMV, AOV, conversion rate daily

- Track competitor strategies



TikTok Paid Ads

- Launch and manage TikTok conversion campaigns

- Test creatives (UGC, hooks, angles)

- Optimize for CPA, ROAS, and GMV

- Scale winning creatives

- Manage budget allocation

- Analyze ad metrics daily

- Work with content team to request specific ad creatives



Meta Ads

- Test prospecting campaigns

Affiliate & Creator Growth

- Track affiliate performance

- Scale top creators

???? KPIs



You will be evaluated on:

- Monthly GMV growth

- Paid ads ROAS

- Cost per acquisition (CPA)

- Conversion rate

- Affiliate-driven revenue

- Creative testing velocity

- Speed of execution



Required Experience

- 2+ years managing TikTok Shop (US market preferred)

- 2+ years running TikTok Ads with proven ROAS

- Experience running Meta Ads (conversion campaigns)

- Experience scaling DTC brands

- Strong analytical skills (comfortable with spreadsheets + ad dashboards)

- Fluent English

Strongly Preferred

- Experience with Shopify backend

-
/SMS marketing familiarity (Klaviyo or similar)

title: Content Writer (Full-Time, Remote – Philippines)
description:
Join an Australian Digital Marketing Agency



We are an Australian digital marketing agency looking for a talented and reliable Content Writer to join our growing offshore content team. You will work closely with our Content Team Lead and Australian team to produce high-quality, SEO-optimised content across a variety of formats.



If you have excellent writing skills, strong attention to detail, and a solid understanding of SEO best practices, we want to hear from you.



About the Role



As a Content Writer, you will be responsible for producing engaging, original, and well-researched content that aligns with our SEO strategy, client goals, and brand standards. You should be able to work independently, manage multiple deadlines, and write without relying on AI tools.





What You’ll Be Doing



Write high-quality SEO content (blogs, SEO pages, articles, Google ads copy).

Research topics and trends to create accurate, engaging content.

Collaborate with the Content Lead and Australia based Account Managers on briefs and feedback.

Optimise content for SEO, readability, and search intent.

Manage multiple writing tasks and meet deadlines consistently.

Self-edit and ensure all content meets quality and originality standards (no AI-generated writing).



Skills & Qualifications



Required Skills



Strong writing and storytelling skills.

Excellent grammar, punctuation, and editorial style knowledge.

Ability to write without the assistance of AI tools.

Strong research and analytical skills.

Good time management and multitasking abilities.

Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

Understanding of SEO and online content strategies.

Creativity and ability to produce original ideas.

Ability to maintain high editorial standards consistently.





Preferred (Nice-to-Have)



Experience writing for digital marketing agencies.

Understanding of topical authority and SEO frameworks.

Ability to detect AI-generated content.



Requirements



Proven experience as a Content Writer or Copywriter.

title: Head of Real Estate Acquisitions
description:
Are you a deal-maker who thrives on the hunt & loves building out systems/processes?



Hello there! Second Bridge Associates is looking for a Head of Acquisitions to serve as a key player in our company growth. We specialize in two primary asset classes:

1) Short-Term Rentals (STRs)

2) Seattle In-Fill Development Projects



Our perfect fit for this role is a strategic partner who is excited to own our entire acquisitions pipeline. You will be the bridge between data analysis and the purchase of high-yield assets.



Availability & Timezone

- Available to work Monday–Friday during Pacific Time (PST) hours.



What You'll Do

- Own Seattle Development & STR Analysis: Develop deep expertise in STR and Seattle development math. You will have the final say on whether a deal meets our feasibility and ROI benchmarks.

- Master the Deal Pipeline: Take full accountability for our deal flow ecosystem. You are accountable for a steady pipeline of 6-8 qualified deals a year. You’ll source opportunities through off-market outreach, wholesaler networks, and on-market channels.

- Lead & Scale Operations: Own the entire team lifecycle from process creation to performance management. You’ll be responsible for creating robust SOPs, while serving as a mentor to our existing team. We look to you to identify talent gaps and strategically expand our acquisitions department as deal flow accelerates.

- Strategize for Market Shifts: When the market moves, you move faster. You’ll proactively refine our buying criteria and pivot strategies to ensure we stay competitive.

- Seamless Handoffs: Once a deal is inked, you’ll lead the transition to our operations team, ensuring every project starts with a clear roadmap and a shared vision.



Who You Are

- A Seasoned Pro: You have a proven track record in real estate acquisitions. You speak the language of sellers, agents, and wholesalers, and know how to build relationships with them.

- A Systems Thinker: You don't just "do" work; you build systems and processes. You’re comfortable in Notion, CRMs, and data-tracking tools to find the right deals from your network and also track them to offers.

- A Leader of Remote Teams: You know how to get the best out of a virtual team, keeping them motivated and high-performing.

- Analytical & Decisive: You can look at a pro-forma and see the risks and rewards instantly. You make data-driven decisions, but you have the gut instinct of a sales closer.

- High Energy & Growth-Oriented: You tackle challenges with a solutions-focused mindset and a touch of humor. You’re here to win and celebrate the wins with the team.



Ideal Candidate Profile

- 4+ Years in Real Estate Acquisitions: Deep experience in deal sourcing, offer negotiation, and closing - specifically in short-term rentals or in-fill development.

- Proven Closer: You have a track record of hitting (and exceeding) volume targets and managing high-value pipelines.

- Architect of Systems: Expert-level ability to build SOPs, design CRM workflows, and turn "hustle" into a repeatable machine.

- Data-Driven Mindset: You live in spreadsheets; you are comfortable defining KPIs and adjusting strategy based on what the numbers say.

- Tool Mastery: Proficiency across Workspace Tools (e.g., Google Sheets, Slack, Notion, Zillow, Redfin, MLS)

- STR Enthusiast: You understand that Short-Term Rentals are a hybrid of real estate and hospitality. You know how to look at the qualitative factors that impact a property’s performance.

- The "Extreme Ownership" Mindset: You don't wait for permission to fix a leak in the pipeline. You identify the problem, build the solution, and report on the results.



Bonus:

- Existing relationships with Seattle-based wholesalers, brokers, or developers. 

- You have a background in Seattle real estate underwriting already or a deep understanding of urban in-fill development. You understand that a "good deal" in Seattle looks different than anywhere else.



Why Join Us?

At Second Bridge Associates, we value curiosity, independence, and results. We’re looking for someone who is excited to grow at our fast-paced company where they will be empowered to take on ownership from Day 1.



If that sounds like you, we’re excited to hear from you :) Ready to find our next great investment? Apply now.

title: Video Editor (Performance-Focused | Premium Brand | Fast Iteration)
description:
We are building a serious creative engine for two premium professional hair brands operating across multiple countries.



If you care about speed, quality, clean design, and building high-performing Meta creatives, keep reading.



What You’ll Be Working On



1- Short-form paid social ads designed for Meta and Instagram that are built to convert, not just look good.



2 - Talking-head content with industry-recognized barbers and stylists, enhanced with engaging b-roll and tight pacing.



3 - Product-focused edits where accuracy and detail matter. When a specific model is mentioned, the correct product must be shown.



4 - Static creatives and motion ads that feel premium, minimalist, and brand-aligned.



5 - Promotions, launches, and inventory pushes where turnaround time is fast and attention to detail is critical.



What Makes This Role Different



1- Your edits won’t sit in a folder. They will go live, quickly.



2 - You’ll receive direct feedback from operators actively running campaigns.



3 - Speed and iteration matter as much as visual polish.



4 - You’ll be trusted to improve pacing, strengthen hooks, and elevate messaging rather than simply execute instructions.



5 - You’ll help shape a growing creative system rather than just fill tasks.



What We Expect From You



1- Strong instinct for short-form pacing, especially within the first 3–5 seconds.



2 - Clean, accurate captions that run correctly throughout the entire video.



3 - Precise product matching between script, text overlays, and visuals.



4 - Clean typography and disciplined use of brand fonts and colors.



5 - Reliable file organization and properly shared links every time.



6 - Ability to handle revisions quickly when a campaign is launching.



The Creative Direction We’re Moving Toward



1- Sleek, minimal, premium visuals.



2 - Product-led messaging with clear value callouts.



3 - Authentic UGC-style edits that still feel polished and intentional.



4 - Real people talking about real products, supported by sharp supporting visuals.



5 - Clear, confident messaging that supports paid acquisition.



The Type of Editor Who Thrives Here



1- Someone who studies high-performing ads in the Meta Ad Library.



2 - Someone who enjoys tightening pacing and refining a cut after feedback.



3 - Someone who cares about accuracy and understands that product details matter.



4 - Someone who moves quickly without sacrificing precision.



5 - Someone who wants their work to have measurable impact.



Growth Potential



1- Opportunity to expand into concept development and creative strategy.



2 - Direct exposure to paid media strategy and campaign launches.



3 - Ownership over creative systems and asset organization.



4 - Long-term growth as the brand scales across multiple markets.



How To Apply



1- Send 3 examples of short-form ads you’ve edited that were used in paid campaigns.



2 - In a few sentences, explain how you approach editing content specifically for Meta ads.



3 - Share a brand whose ads you think are well done and explain why.

title: GoHighLevel Specialist – Automations, Funnels & Systems (Insurance Industry | Long-Term Role)
description:
Pay: $10–$12/hour (based on proven skill)

Type: Full-time, long-term

Start: ASAP

Primary Tool: GoHighLevel

Secondary: Meta Ads support



ABOUT US



We are a growing U.S.-based insurance agency generating Medicare and health insurance leads. Our team is young, driven, and system-focused. GoHighLevel is the core system that runs our funnels, CRM, automations, and internal processes.



We are hiring ONE GoHighLevel specialist to own our automations, funnel builds, system maintenance, and process improvements long-term.



This is not a freelance or side-gig role.



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR

You:



- Have strong, hands-on GoHighLevel experience

- Communicate clearly and professionally in English

- Are confident building automations, workflows, pipelines, and funnels

- Can maintain, troubleshoot, and improve existing systems

- Think in processes and systems, not just tasks

- Understand how
 ads connect to funnels

- Learn fast and adapt when new needs come up

- Want stability and long-term growth



WHAT YOU’LL DO



- Build and maintain insurance lead funnels in GoHighLevel

- Create, manage, and optimize workflows and automations

- Maintain pipelines, forms, calendars, and follow-ups

- Troubleshoot broken automations, funnels, or integrations

- Improve internal processes and system efficiency

- Document workflows and SOPs as systems evolve

- Provide support for
 ad funnels

(tracking, funnel connections, landing page updates — not full media buying)



NON-NEGOTIABLES



- Strong GoHighLevel experience (automations + funnels)

- Experience maintaining and optimizing existing GHL systems

- Ability to work independently and solve problems

- Available full-time

- Not working with multiple clients



APPLICATION QUESTIONS



Applications without clear answers will be rejected.

1. What automations and workflows have you personally built or maintained inside GoHighLevel?

(Be specific.)

2. If a GoHighLevel automation stops working, what are the first steps you take to diagnose and fix it?



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



To apply, submit:



1. Your answers to the 2 application questions above

2. Start your application with this exact phrase:

“GHL SYSTEMS – READY TO BUILD”



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.



NEXT STEPS



Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a brief GoHighLevel skills test relevant to the insurance industry.



WHY THIS ROLE IS DIFFERENT



- Long-term, stable position

- Clear ownership of systems and processes

- Opportunity to improve and scale real operations

- Exposure to funnels, automations, and ad-driven systems

- Work directly with decision-makers

title: SOA Production & Client Services Officer
description:
SOA Production & Client Services Officer 



Location: Remote (Philippines) 

Hours: Full-time, 6:00am – 3:00pm Manila Time (aligned with Australian business hours) 

Availability: Must be online and available on Microsoft Teams during work hours 



About Us 



We are an Australian financial advice business specialising in retirement and aged care financial planning. Our work is structured, process-driven, and detail-focused. 



We are seeking a highly organised, detail-oriented tea
mber to support the preparation and quality control of financial advice documents and client records. 



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working with numbers, following clear processes, and ensuring everything is accurate and complete. 



The Role 



You will be responsible for assembling, checking, and organising financial planning documents using our structured templates and step-by-step processes. 



You will not be giving financial advice. 



You will be executing and quality-checking within a defined system. 



Key Responsibilities 



• Input financial data accurately into templates and internal systems 

• Assist in preparing Statements of Advice and aged care strategy documents 

• Follow structured checklists to ensure accuracy and completeness 

• Review documents carefully to identify inconsistencies or missing information 

• Maintain clean and organised digital client files 

• Draft clear internal notes and summaries 

• Support Centrelink and aged care documentation preparation 

• Ensure version control and proper file naming conventions 

• Raise questions early when information is unclear or incomplete 



What We Are Looking For 



This is a high attention-to-detail role. Accuracy matters. 



You must: 



• Be extremely detail-oriented and methodical 

• Be comfortable working with numbers and financial information 

• Follow processes precisely without shortcuts 

• Have strong written English skills 

• Be organised and structured in your work 

• Be comfortable working independently while remaining responsive on Teams 

• Be reliable, punctual, and focused during work hours 



Previous experience in an Australian financial planning firm, mortgage broking firm, or financial services outsourcing company is highly regarded but not mandatory. 



Data entry, loan processing, financial administration, or document QA experience is advantageous. 



Work Expectations 



• Full-time position 

• 6:00am – 3:00pm Manila Time 

• Must be online and available on Microsoft Teams during working hours 

• Stable internet connection required 

• Quiet and professional work environment 



We will provide structured training in our processes and systems. 



Our Culture 



We value: 



• Precision 

• Accountability 

• Clear communication 

• Professionalism 

• Continuous improvement 



This is not a creative or sales role. It is a structured production role suited to someone who takes pride in accuracy and organisation. 



We offer: 

 

Remote work position 

13th-month pay 

Work schedule from 6 am to 3 pm, Manila time 

Weekends off 

Collaborative and supportive team environment 



Application Process 



To apply: 

 





Submit your resume through the link. 

Complete the FaceCruit video interview. 

Successful candidates from that stage will complete a personality assessment. 



Only applications submitted through the application link will be reviewed. 

We are hiring immediately and encourage prompt applications.

title: Senior Financial Operator/ Controller-Level Bookkeeper
description:
Position Summary

We are seeking a highly capable and strategic financial operator to serve as a senior-level bookkeeper/controller for our fast-paced, multi-entity real estate enterprise. This role supports our real estate brokerage team, investment and development projects, and the personal financial operations of the CEO. The ideal candidate combines technical accounting expertise with strategic insight and the ability to manage complex, multi-entity structures in a lean, high-performance environment.



Key Responsibilities

- Maintain full-cycle bookkeeping for brokerage, investment entities, and project-specific LLCs.

- Oversee job cost accounting, project-level reporting, and GAAP-compliant multi-entity financials.

- Lead monthly closes, consolidate reports, and provide variance analysis.

- Perform weekly/monthly reconciliations of all accounts and ensure books are audit-ready.

- Maintain documentation and prepare reports for CPA coordination and tax filings.

- Ensure accurate 1099 issuance and vendor W-9 compliance.

- Build rolling cash flow forecasts and participate in capital allocation decisions.

- Manage the CEO’s personal finances, including financial tracking, reporting, and investment oversight.

- Support quarterly strategy sessions with data and insight, not just numbers.



Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA or CMA preferred.

- 5+ years experience in bookkeeping or financial management, ideally in real estate.

- Strong command of US GAAP, project accounting, and inter-entity financial structures.

- Proficiency in QuickBooks, project tracking systems, and financial dashboards.

- Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and communication skills.

- Experience managing personal financials for executives a strong plus.



Ideal Candidate Traits

- Strategic thinker who loves both numbers and their meaning.

- Exceptionally organized and accountable.

- Proactive problem-solver who can navigate lean operations.

- Deeply reliable and detail-oriented with a high sense of ownership.

- Comfortable with both the tactical and strategic aspects of finance.



Compensation & Benefits

- Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.

- Flexible work environment and working remotely.

- Performance-based incentives and potential for expanded leadership role.



In your cover letter, begin with the word "focused" and include a 1 minute introduction video link telling more about yourself and share your qualifications/experiences that makes you a great fit for this role. If you fail to follow this instruction, you'll not be considered for this role.

title: Cold Caller/ Virtual assistant
description:
Company: Any Home Cincy

Location: Remote / USA-based company 

Position Type: Part-Time / Full-Time



About Us:

Any Home Cincy is a local, family-owned property buying company that helps homeowners sell quickly and without hassle. We have been in business for over two years and are actively growing. We are looking for serious, results-driven tea
mbers who can professionally represent our company and help us find real opportunities.

We are hiring fluent English-speaking cold callers with real estate experience to contact property owners from company-provided lists. Your primary responsibility is to identify motivated sellers, thoroughly qualify leads, find legitimate deals, and set strong appointments for our acquisitions team.

 groups and online platforms to maintain company presence

Competitive base pay + performance-based bonuses tied to qualified appointments and closed deals.



We are looking for someone thorough, disciplined, and hungry to find real deals — not just make calls.





We are setting up interviews this week via zoom/google meet.

title: Sales Assistant
description:
About us: 

EMRG is an award-winning Digital Marketing Agency based in Los Angeles. With a team of experienced professionals for each service line, we offer a wide range of digital marketing solutions that are customized to meet the unique needs of each client. We are renowned for our outstanding customer service and ability to deliver exceptional `results. As a leading agency in the industry, we have established ourselves as a reliable partner for businesses looking to grow and expand their online presence.

As our company continues to grow, we are also committed to expanding our philanthropic goals and supporting children in need worldwide.



Job Title: Remote Sales Assistant - Digital Marketing



Job Description:

As a Remote Sales Assistant in the digital marketing industry, you will play a vital role in supporting the sales team and ensuring the smooth operation of the digital marketing sales process. Your primary responsibility will be to assist with various sales tasks, including lead generation, client communication, and sales administration. Working remotely, you will collaborate closely with the sales team and other stakeholders to drive sales growth and meet revenue targets.



Responsibilities:

Lead Generation:  Conduct research and identify potential clients through various online platforms: social media channels, Linked IN, Sales Navigator, and industry databases. Initiating Outbound outreach (outbound calls and sending outbound
). Collect and organize relevant information, such as contact details and company profiles, for further outreach.



Client Communication: Communicate with prospective clients via
, phone, or online messaging platforms. Introduce the company's digital marketing services, answer inquiries, and schedule appointments or product demonstrations.



Sales Support: Assist the sales team in preparing sales presentations, proposals, and contracts. Coordinate with internal teams, such as marketing and creative departments, to gather necessary materials and ensure timely delivery to clients.



CRM Management: Utilize customer relationship management (CRM) software to maintain accurate and up-to-date client records, track sales activities, and generate reports. Monitor and update the sales pipeline to reflect the progress of leads and opportunities.



Relationship Building: Foster positive and long-lasting relationships with clients, acting as a reliable point of contact. Provide exceptional customer service, address concerns, and identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell additional digital marketing services.



Market Research: Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging digital marketing strategies. Share relevant insights with the sales team to refine sales approaches and stay ahead in the competitive market.



Sales Administration: Perform administrative tasks, such as data entry, document management, and sales performance tracking. Assist with the organization and coordination of sales events, trade shows, and webinars.



Requirements:

Proven experience as a sales assistant or in a similar sales support role.

Legal Marketing Experience is a plus

Able to quickly capture and summarize notes

Highly organized, Can manage tasks, deadlines, and follow-ups efficiently.

Understands client needs and project scope with ease.

Fluent, with a neutral accent preferred (but not required) for clear communication

Experience in digital marketing concepts and practices.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.

Proficiency in using CRM software and other sales-related tools.

Self-motivated and able to work effectively in a remote work environment.

Attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate records.

Knowledge of market research techniques is a plus.



Join our dynamic digital marketing team as a Remote Sales Assistant and contribute to our mission of helping businesses achieve their marketing goals through innovative digital strategies.

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
Job Description: Account Manager (Digital Marketing)



We are a rapidly growing digital marketing agency based in Los Angeles seeking a highly accountable, decisive, and client-focused Account Manager to manage and grow a portfolio of client accounts. This role goes beyond basic client servicing — it requires strong judgment, confident communication, independent problem-solving, and consistent execution.

The ideal candidate is someone who can handle client pressure with composure, make informed decisions without constant escalation, and translate plans into results. You will be responsible for maintaining client trust, resolving issues proactively, and identifying opportunities to grow accounts through strategic upsells.



We prioritize personal and professional growth and offer mentoring, continued education, performance reviews with bonuses, annual raises, and a collaborative team culture.



Key Responsibilities

-Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned client accounts, maintaining clear, confident, and professional communication at all times

-Manage client expectations, address concerns independently, and resolve conflicts in a timely and solutions-oriented manner

-Make informed decisions on client matters and propose clear action plans rather than relying solely on escalation

-Lead client onboarding efficiently and ensure a strong foundation is established early in the relationship

-Coordinate with internal teams to ensure tasks are executed accurately, on time, and aligned with client goals

-Own execution of account plans, ensuring follow-through from strategy to completion

-Identify and initiate account growth opportunities, including upsells, with proper timing and client readiness

-Manage priorities effectively across multiple accounts, demonstrating strong time management and organization

-Maintain accurate task tracking, documentation, and reporting using project management tools

-Collaborate with accounting to ensure accurate billing and time tracking

-Handle special projects and new initiatives as needed





Required Skills & Qualifications

-Proven experience in client or account management (digital marketing experience preferred)

-Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills, with the ability to act independently and confidently

-Excellent written and verbal English communication skills; able to sound natural, human, and professional (not scripted or robotic)

-Ability to remain calm, structured, and solution-driven during client conflicts or high-pressure situations

-Demonstrated ability to execute plans consistently and manage time effectively across competing priorities

-Strong relationship-building skills with clients and internal stakeholders

-Familiarity with digital marketing services and workflows

-Experience using task management tools such as 
, Trello, or ActiveCollab



Ideal Candidate Traits

-High ownership and accountability

-Comfortable making decisions and proposing strategies without constant supervision

-Execution-driven and results-oriented

-Emotionally intelligent and composed under pressure

-Organized, proactive, and disciplined with time management



Important Application Requirement

-As part of our screening process, all applicants are required to submit the results of their 16PF (Sixteen Personality Factor) Assessment prior to applying.

-Applications without a submitted 16PF assessment result will not be entertained.



-16PF link: 

This assessment helps us ensure alignment with the demands of the role and our working environment.



Learn more about us

title: Full-Stack Developer – E-Commerce Platform
description:
ABOUT US



We are a US-based commerce company, the American arm of an established European e-commerce and trading group operating across 29 countries with 650,000+ products across multiple brands in construction, home improvement, sustainability, and premium bath & kitchen.



We are building a modular, AI-powered e-commerce platform and we need a developer who can build it with us.

Our motto: "Do it with Passion or don't do it at all."



THIS IS NOT A TYPICAL DEV ROLE

We don't need someone who waits for tickets. We need a builder who reads a spec and ships a prototype. You work directly with the CEO and his Operations Manager – a tight three-person core team. Fast decisions, no bureaucracy.

WHAT YOU'LL WORK ON



Data Connectors

Product Information Management (PIM)

Pricing Engine

Multi-Channel Feed Management

EDI Middleware (EDIFACT D96A – ORDERS, ORDRSP, DESADV, INVOIC)

Controlling & Finance Dashboards

Workflow Automation & Internal Tooling



TECH STACK



React, TypeScript, Python

Supabase (PostgreSQL)

n8n, Docker, Kong

Ollama, Claude API

Hetzner, GitHub Actions



MUST HAVE



3+ years full-stack (React + Python or TypeScript)

Strong PostgreSQL

REST API design and integration

Docker + Linux server admin

Can set up a full environment from scratch

Excellent English (daily standups with CEO and Ops Manager)



NICE TO HAVE



Supabase, n8n, Polars

E-commerce / marketplace experience

AI/ML integration



YOUR GROWTH PATH

Month 1–3: Infrastructure, first modules live.

Month 3–6: Core platform operational.

Month 6–12: Platform expands. You build your team.

Year 2+: CTO conversation. You built it, you lead it.

WHAT WE OFFER



Competitive salary (full-time, permanent)

Performance bonus

3-person core team – CEO, Ops Manager, and you

No legacy code – build from scratch

Flexible hours (4h CET overlap)

Modern stack, no bloat

Path: Developer #1 ? CTO

Hardware budget



NON-NEGOTIABLE



Excellent English (C1/C2)

3+ years full-stack experience

4+ hours daily CET overlap

Reliable internet, professional home office

Based in Philippines or Vietnam



HOW TO APPLY



CV (PDF)

Short intro: Why this role? What have you built? (3–5 sentences)

GitHub or portfolio links

Salary expectation (monthly, USD)

Earliest start date



BONUS CHALLENGE (Optional)

Parse this EDIFACT message into JSON and include it with your application:

UNH+1+ORDERS:D:96A:UN:EAN008'BGM+220+PO
+9'LIN+1+
:SRV'QTY+21:50'PRI+AAA:12.50'

title: Product Setup & Catalog Specialist (Shopify / RetailOps)
description:
Summary



US retailer is hiring a detail-oriented Product Setup & Catalog Specialist to build and maintain products across Shopify and RetailOps. This role supports new item setup from purchase orders, product launches, catalog maintenance, and the media/bundle workflows that keep product pages accurate and ready to sell.



What You’ll Do 



1) Product Setup & Catalog Management



Create new SKUs from POs/invoices using our Excel templates and upload into RetailOps.



Maintain clean, consistent product data (titles, SKUs, UPCs, pricing, categories, manufacturer info).



Handle ongoing catalog updates as needed (occasional brand-driven changes, Open Box item creation, storefront inventory additions).



2) Launch & Project Support



Prepare new product launches ahead of time by creating items in draft status before go-live dates.



Track deadlines and requests in Asana and stay on top of “My Tasks” to keep work moving.



3) Media & Merchandising (Images, Video, Bundles)



Source and prep product images (portals, manufacturer sites), crop/resize to standards, upload to our image server (FileZilla), and build image URLs.



Add product videos (upload to YouTube Studio and load to Shopify via Matrixify templates).



Build and maintain bundles using Shopify/Matrixify templates, including occasional conversion from legacy bundle formats.



Tools You’ll Use



Excel / Google Sheets, Shopify, RetailOps, Matrixify, FileZilla, Asana, YouTube Studio.



What We’re Looking For



Strong attention to detail (SKUs, UPCs, pricing, naming conventions).



Comfortable working in Excel templates and structured upload workflows.



Experience in e-commerce product setup (Shopify preferred).



Able to source missing product details (UPCs/specs) and communicate with internal teams and brand reps.



Organized file management and ability to juggle multiple deadlines.



Preferred (Nice to Have)



RetailOps experience, Matrixify power-user experience, bundle creation experience, basic image editing background.



Location: [Remote / USA hours]

title: Marketing & Brand Manager (Part-Time | 20–30 hrs/week | PST Hours)
description:
About Us



We’re a fast-growing, people-first painting company based in Canada. Our brand is built on trust, craftsmanship, and clear communication — not pushy sales tactics.



We’re looking for a hands-on Marketing & Brand Manager who can take ownership of our day-to-day marketing execution and help us generate consistent, high-quality local leads while protecting and strengthening our brand.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants ownership, stability, and real impact.



Your Mission

Keep our brand visible, consistent, and high-quality across:

Website & local SEO

Google Business Profile

Social media

/newsletters

Referral & partnership initiatives

Paid ads

You won’t just “post content.” You’ll build systems, track results, and continuously improve what’s working.



What Success Looks Like (First 60–90 Days)

Consistent posting cadence with a simple content calendar

Website pages updated and SEO basics improved

Regular before/after project content published

Fully managed Google Business Profile (posts, reviews, photos, Q&A)

Clean tracking and monthly reporting

Referral + partnership programs actively implementedCore Responsibilities

Manage
, Instagram, and LinkedIn



Post:

Before-and-after projects

Short project recaps

Educational homeowner tips

Light brand storytelling (team, values, process)

Build and organize a simple content library



3. Google Business Profile & Reputation

Weekly posts and photo uploads

Help implement systems to consistently generate reviews



4. Referral Programs & Partnerships

Build relationships with aligned local partners (realtors, designers, builders, etc.)

Track and optimize referral performance



5.
 & Newsletter Marketing

Manage monthly newsletters

Repurpose blog content into
 + social

Maintain a simple monthly communications plan



6. Paid Ads (Meta + Local Campaigns)

Set up and optimize local ad campaigns

Coordinate landing pages + tracking (UTMs, basic conversion tracking)

Manage budget responsibly

Report on ROI, CPL, and lead quality



7. Reporting & Optimization

Provide monthly reporting on:

Website traffic

Google Business Profile performance

Social engagement

Lead volume + cost per lead

Review growth

And most importantly: bring recommendations on what to stop, start, and scale.



Tools We Use

Canva / Adobe

ClickUp

Slack

ChatGPT (for ideation and drafts — you polish everything)



Work Expectations

Required Experience

Must-Have:

Proven experience managing marketing for a local service business (or similar)

Strong writing and editing skills (clear, warm, professional)

Solid understanding of local SEO and Google Business Profile

Experience running social media content systems

Organized, proactive, and deadline-driven



Nice to Have:

 marketing platform experience

Personal Traits We Value

Why Join Us?

Clear expectations and measurable impact

title: PHONE EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT – PROPERTY MANAGEMENT (REMOTE)
description:
YOU (THE CANDIDATE):

You are the kind of woman who treats your work like it's your business. You thrive in a role where communication, intelligence, and quick thinking matter every single day. You are thrilled by the idea of a lifetime job opportunity instead of applying for 100 new jobs every 6 months.



Read these carefully - if this sounds like you, you’re who we want:



• You love speaking with people - idea of encouraging tenants to renew their lease or confidently talking with new applicants about why they should choose our homes actually energizes you.

• You’re calm, patient, and solution-focused under pressure - when you receive calls about issues, your natural instinct is to resolve, not get flustered.

• You speak exceptional English with a clear voice and minimal accent - the kind that U.S.-based callers can easily understand on the phone.

• You are resourceful and skilled at problem solving, able to think on your feet, and naturally good at handling unexpected or challenging situations.

• You consider yourself highly intelligent - the type of person others rely on when something tricky needs solving.

• You have prior work-from-home experience and know how to manage yourself independently.

• You have a proven history of staying with past employers and not switching jobs every year.

• You want stable, long-term, full-time employment and value security over chasing short-term high pay that disappears.

If this is you authentically - not aspirationally - we want to meet you (even if you haven’t worked in Property Management before).

_____________________________



US (THE COMPANY):

• We are a U.S. based long-term rental property company - not Airbnb, not short-term rentals.

• We currently manage 100+ houses and are growing quickly.

• We expect to reach another 100–200 homes in the next two years.

• We value ladies who want long-term stability with us - 10 years, not 10 months.

_____________________________



COMMITMENT FROM YOU:

 • Availability: Monday–Friday, 7 AM–7 PM Pacific Time | Active working hours occur within that window

_____________________________

title: D5 Video Rendering Specialist (Construction & Demolition Projects)
description:
Company: Hushtec

Location: Remote (Work from Home)

Hours: Full-Time Preferred (Open to Part-Time for the Right Candidate)



About Hushtec



Hushtec is a 3x global award-winning brand specializing in acoustic wall systems and noise control solutions across New Zealand and international markets. We work on large-scale construction, demolition, and infrastructure projects — helping keep worksites compliant, safe, and professional.



We already have a small, high-performing remote team in the Philippines, and we’re now looking to add a skilled D5 Video Rendering Specialist to join us.



If you love turning technical designs into powerful, realistic visual content — and you can do it fast and efficiently — we’d love to hear from you.



The Role



We are looking for someone experienced in creating high-quality D5 render videos quickly and efficiently.



Your primary focus will be producing realistic, professional video renders of:



Construction sites



Demolition sites



Acoustic wall installations



Temporary site setups



Large infrastructure environments



These videos will be used for marketing, client proposals, tenders, and online promotions.



Speed and quality both matter in this role.



What You’ll Be Doing



Creating realistic D5 render animations from CAD models and drawings



Producing short, engaging construction-focused video content



Working closely with our design and remote team



Meeting fast turnaround times



Optimizing scenes for efficient rendering



Adding environmental realism (machinery, workers, dust, lighting, movement)



Making revisions based on feedback



What We’re Looking For



Required Experience:



Strong hands-on experience using D5 Render



Proven experience creating video renders (not just still images)



Experience rendering construction, infrastructure, or demolition environments



Ability to work fast without sacrificing quality



Good understanding of lighting, materials, and realistic motion



Reliable internet and work setup



Bonus Skills (Highly Valued):



Experience working with SketchUp, Revit, or other CAD platforms



Understanding of construction environments



Basic video editing skills



Experience working with international clients



The Type of Person Who Will Succeed Here



Efficient and organised



Proactive and responsive



Comfortable working remotely



Open to feedback and continuous improvement



Enjoys working as part of a team



You’ll be joining a supportive remote Filipino team that already works closely with us. We value loyalty, long-term relationships, and people who want to grow with the company.



Hours & Pay



Full-time preferred (45 hours per week)



Open to part-time for the right highly skilled candidate



Competitive salary based on experience



Long-term opportunity with growth potential

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
Job Title: Accountant Receivables Specialist (remote)



Company: Picnic Time, Inc. DBA Picnic Time Family of Brands



Picnic Time is a successful & sunny SoCal-based wholesale supplier of premium outdoor leisure, gift, and promotional products established in a garage in 1982. (Don’t worry, we have a real office now.) We know picnic, we love picnic, and we live picnic – it’s literally in our name.

Who we are: The Picnic Time Family is all about the people. We're a diverse team of hard-working yet easy-going people that care about what we're doing. If it weren't for the amazing group of people at Picnic Time, we wouldn't be where we are today.

What we do: We create quality products that are thoughtful, sustainable, and fun.  

When we do it:  We've been innovating since 1982 and we don't have any intention of slowing down.  The hope is that we'll be here creating great stuff for your kids' kids' kids!

Where the magic happens:  We were born in a small garage in West Hills, CA and moved to a bigger (ware)house in a small town, Moorpark, CA, in 1990.  We've been rockin’ the suburbs ever since!

Why we do what we do (this is the big one):  Our purpose for existing is to bring family and friends together so that they can make lasting memories...because that's what happiness is all about.  Each and every decision we make is ultimately geared toward that goal.

How we do it:  We're constantly driving towards our purpose via our 8 core values of Fun, Growth, Integrity, Collaboration, Innovation, Service, Productivity, and Passion.



Mission Statement: To create products that inspire friends and family to come together and make lasting memories – and have a great time doing it.



Job Description: The Accounts receivable Specialist processes receivable transactions, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.

Responsibilities include: 

• Process receivable transactions, including verifying invoices, open credit memos and debit memos, and monitoring outstanding balances.

• Download deposit details and/or extract payment remittances from the customer website or portal.

• Apply collections against the customer accounts. Investigate and dispute unauthorized deductions or chargebacks.

• Send collection letters and coordinate with the Customer Accounts Payable Dept. to ensure timely collection of the open invoices.  

• Process credit card transactions and apply against open invoices. 

• Conduct regular credit card reconciliations and review payment applications for accuracy.

• Conduct regular bank reconciliations and review financial transactions for accuracy.



Qualifications:

• Minimum 2 years of experience in accounts receivable.

• Experience with CRM software a plus.

• Self-motivated, results-oriented, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

• Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

• Strong understanding of GAAP and other accounting principles

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

• Experience with accounting software such as Great Plains.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, advanced Excel, including VLOOKUP and Macros.

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

• Ability to meet tight deadlines and handle multiple tasks simultaneously

Specific skills required:

• Ability to speak and write in English

• Fast and reliable internet service

• Excellent intrapersonal skills 

• Excellent project management and organizational skills

• Ability to work independently and proactively



Reports to: Accounting Supervisor



Location: Remote – VPN access to virtual desk in Moorpark, CA 93021, USA

Hours: 8:30 AM – 5 PM Monday – Friday PST (West Coast USA)

Salary: US$6.50 per hour (Paid $520 every two weeks) 

Employee Type: Full Time, Hourly (Independent Contractor)

title: Jewelry Artist/Designer
description:

If you don't have experience with anime, that is ok, we will guide you clearly with our design aesthetics and vision.



Task:

    * Design concept sketches and product mockups for watches or jewellery (rings, pendants, bracelets, or timepieces) inspired by anime themes

    * Balance fan recognisability with premium, minimalist design suitable for commercial production

    * Understanding of materials, production processes, and proportions for wearable products



Nice to haves:

    3. Describe your recent experience with similar projects.

title: Australian Mortgage Broker (Mercury CRM Essential) Virtual Assistant
description:
Virtual Assistant – Mortgage Brokerage Assistant and Admin Generalist. 



Why work with Talentport?

We are an established Australian trade services group handling projects across construction, civil works and specialist maintenance, finance and marketing with a diverse array of clients.



Overview:

We are seeking a highly organised, proactive, and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant

to support our client and their growing mortgage brokerage business. The ideal candidate will possess

strong communication skills, hands-on experience with *Connective Mercury*, and the

ability to manage administrative tasks with precision and discretion as an essential requirement. 



You will play a vital role in supporting brokers, assisting clients, and ensuring their loan processes

run efficiently from start to finish.



Key Responsibilities

1. Administrative Support (Critical Organisational Skills Required)

- Manage and respond to
s, calls, and messages from clients, lenders, and other stakeholders.

- Schedule meetings, client consultations, and follow-ups using calendar tools.

- Maintain organised digital filing systems for client documents and internal records.



2. Client Onboarding and Communication 

Assist in gathering and organising client documentation (e.g., income

verification, credit reports, bank statements). Provide regular updates to clients regarding their loan status. Help clients understand the next steps in the mortgage process and address general inquiries.



3. Document Management

- Prepare and review loan application packets for completeness and accuracy.

- Track submission deadlines and follow up on outstanding documents.

- Ensure compliance with internal and external documentation standards.



4. CRM and Data Entry

- Use Connective Mercury to manage client data, track loan progress, generate compliance documents, and lodge applications.

- Maintain up-to-date records of loan pipelines, status updates, and compliance milestones.

- Generate reports and assist with monitoring broker KPIs through Mercury.



5. Lender Coordination

Liaise with banks, credit unions, and non-bank lenders to follow up on loan

applications. Track lender document requests and ensure timely responses. 

Lodge supporting documents and manage correspondence via Mercury.



Required Skills and; Qualifications

- Experience using Connective Mercury CRM is preferred but not essential.

- Previous experience in mortgage broking, lending, or real estate preferred.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

- High level of accuracy, discretion, and professionalism.

- Strong organisational and multitasking abilities.

- Proficient in tools such as Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, Zoom, and cloud file management (e.g., Dropbox, Google Drive). 

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

- Understanding of Australian mortgage products and compliance processes is a strong advantage.



Work Schedule:

- Fully remote

- Flexible working hours  

- Full Time

title: Video Editor - Emotional Storytelling for Garment Releases
description:
My brand is building towards a more story-driven brand. Every garment we release carries meaning — rooted in family history, upbringing, identity, sacrifice, culture, and lived experience. These are not only product drops but stories that hold dear to the community we are planning to build.



We are looking for a video editor who understands how to translate emotion into short-form content. Think of it as a POV come with me to design clothes, but all the design choices are related to a real life story that we are proud to share.



The Role



You will turn provided storylines into emotionally compelling short-form videos centered around the story with the garment being the subject at the end. Its a story line about process and narrative of why we picked certain things.



I will provide:

 • The core story behind each piece along with a general script

 • The intended tone and message

        •.      I will have audio for the video and footage



You will:

 • Bring that story to life visually.

 • Source complementary footage that strengthens the narrative (only if needed)

 • Edit with intention — pacing, music, silence, transitions, and typography must all support the emotional weight of the story.

        •.       At the end of it, I really should feel an emotional connection



?



Responsibilities

 • Follow a structured storyline and build a visual arc around it.

 • Source high-quality footage that reinforces themes of identity, struggle, growth, family, or culture.

 • Use sound design and music intentionally to create emotional depth.

 • Deliver platform-ready content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.

 • Closely match a defined storytelling style (examples will be shared).



?



Requirements

 • Strong proficiency in Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or equivalent.

 • Proven ability to create emotionally driven edits.

 • Strong sense of pacing and restraint — knowing when to let 
nts breathe.

 • Attention to detail in typography, color grading, and transitions.

 • Experience editing for short-form vertical platforms.



We are looking for someone who understands that storytelling requires subtlety and control not over-editing.



?



Test Project



Shortlisted candidates will complete a paid test.



You will receive:

 • A base storyline

 • A style reference video



Your task is to produce a short-form edit that captures the emotional tone and visual style while honoring the story provided.



We will assess:

 • Emotional execution

 • Story pacing

 • Creative judgment

 • Ability to interpret brand direction



?



How to Apply



Please include:

 • Links to relevant work (especially emotionally driven edits).

 • A short note explaining why storytelling-based fashion content interests you.

 • Your availability and working hours.



My brand is building a collective of stories through garments. If you know how to make people feel something through video, we want to see your work.

title: Tax Resolution Case Worker
description:
We're looking for an experienced tax professional who can handle high-volume IRS resolution case management. This isn't a data-entry position - you'll be managing your own caseload of 50+ cases, communicating with clients, and driving cases to completion.

This is a demanding role. If you can't handle 50+ simultaneous cases with clear accountability metrics, this isn't for you.

You'll Be Responsible For

• Managing 50+ active resolution cases (Offers in Compromise, installment agreements, penalty abatement, collections defense, etc.)

• Updating case management system (Pitbull Tax) daily with case progress

• Responding to client requests within 24 hours

• Participating in daily team huddles via Zoom

• Meeting weekly case movement and completion targets



To Apply

Send to 

•	Resume highlighting IRS resolution experience (include number of cases managed)

•	2-3 minute video introduction

•	Brief explanation: "Describe a complex IRS resolution case you managed from intake to closure, including the outcome"

Start Date: Immediate

title: SMS Campaign Specialist (Real Estate )
description:
Please review this job post completely before applying.



Job Title: SMS Campaign Specialist

Location: Remote (Must work EST hours)

Job Type: Full-Time, Long-Term

Hours: 40 hours/week

Start Date: Immediate (within the next 7 days)



About Us:



We’re a growing real estate investment company focused on off-market deals. Our acquisition team works directly with motivated sellers, and SMS outreach is a core channel for generating leads.



This is not a general VA role. We’re hiring ONLY experienced SMS specialists. If SMS was just 20% of your last job, this position is not for you.



Who We’re Looking For:



– You’ve managed daily SMS outreach as your main job — not just as a side task

– You’ve worked with tools like Launch Control, GoHighLevel, Smarter Contact, etc.

– You understand deliverability, compliance, opt-out logic, and spam filters

– You know how to tag leads, track replies, and move qualified prospects into CRM

– You’re not using a phone — you’ve used professional platforms and tools

– You can handle 1,500+ outbound texts/day and rotate templates properly

– You’re available full-time (45 hrs/week), working EST hours



Key Responsibilities:



– Run high-volume SMS campaigns daily using proper systems

– Monitor responses and qualify leads based on script and criteria

– Manage templates and rotate messages to avoid filtering

– Tag leads accurately and track campaign metrics

– Coordinate with acquisition and data teams to align campaigns



Required Experience:



– Minimum 1 year managing SMS outreach full-time

– Real estate investment or wholesaling background is a major plus

– Strong written English — clear, professional, and natural tone

– Familiarity with CRMs and SMS platforms

– Must be organized, reliable, and fully independent



How to Apply:



We only review serious applications from experienced SMS specialists.



Apply using the link below:




/1uMRkxneOR1Kn0C3UdI9_6A1avdy



Incomplete applications or generic submissions will not be reviewed.

- Growth opportunities for high performers

, and newsletters

, WhatsApp, SMS)

title: CONTENT RESEARCH EXPERT (CRE): $800 a month
description:
BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 7.5 hours/day

- Schedule: Monday to Friday, flexible time

- Salary: $800 a month

- Paid every two weeks via Wise. (direct to your bank account, almost no fees, no waiting for payday!)

- Work with the latest AI tools and social media platforms

- Research 30-50 viral short-form videos on Instagram Reels and TikTok

- Strategically select content ideas that will help specific clients go viral

- Organize all content ideas in the "Client Master Sheet"

- Copy/paste links to each content piece

- Write out the hook of each content piece

- Categorize content (Hero Story, Educational, Entertaining, Promotional)

- Add precise video instructions on how each piece can be replicated



TASK #2: Provide Strategic Content Direction



- Analyze client information (niche, target audience, personality, content style)

- Identify and recommend 3 inspirational accounts for clients to follow in their niche

- Create detailed instructions for content replication tailored to the client's abilities

- Think strategically about what will help each client succeed



TASK #3: Administrative Responsibilities



- Maintain a content library categorized by niche for efficient future use

- Complete daily End-of-Day Reports (EOD)

- Attend multiple meetings with your manager each week

- Continuously improve content recommendations based on what works



REQUIREMENTS



- Excellent English skills (C1 or above - non-negotiable!)

- Previous experience in content creation is a MUST

- Experience in content research and trend analysis

- Strong understanding of what makes content go viral

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts features

- Strategic thinking and attention to detail

- Ability to provide clear, actionable instructions

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

- 100% say-do ratio and commitment to deadlines



HOW TO APPLY



ROUND 1: Complete our application form and record a personal introduction:



Fill out the form: 
/to/QRoz4WLV



Note: Put "CRE" + [Your Name & Family Name] in the "Name" field in the form.



Record a 3-minute Loom video introducing yourself (instructions in form)



Important: Please provide genuine, personal responses (no AI-written answers). We want to get to know YOU!



ROUND 2: Qualified candidates will be invited for an interview.



MORE ABOUT US



We've been in the industry since 2019 and have worked with over 3000 clients. We currently receive around 80-100 new clients per month. We provide an "80% done-for-you content & monetization system" that helps creators go viral and turn views into income using short-form content, AI, and proven strategies.
