title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: Finance & Admin Assistant
description:
We’re looking for a highly organized, numbers-savvy operator to help us stay financially sharp and operationally smooth as we scale our short-term rental business. You’ll own the day-to-day financial admin — from invoicing to investor reports — and help keep our backend tidy, transparent, and ready to grow.



If you love spreadsheets, crave clarity, and get a weird sense of joy from balancing books — keep reading.



What You’ll Be Doing



Balance Sheets & Bookkeeping: Keep our numbers up-to-date, accurate, and ready to report.



Tax & Compliance: Track VAT thresholds, prep filings, and handle tax-related tasks (no last-minute scrambles).



Business Rates: Apply for rates on relevant properties when needed.



Payroll Support: Process monthly payroll and keep tidy records.



Accounts Payable & Receivable: Stay on top of who owes us and who we owe.



Financial Statements: Create clean, clear profit & loss statements that help us make smart decisions.



Invoicing: Send invoices, chase payments, and make sure the cash keeps flowing.



Reporting & Analysis: Build and maintain Excel dashboards showing monthly profit by property, channel performance, occupancy, and more.



Investor Reports: Prep monthly reports detailing income, costs, and payouts for each property.



General Admin: Help with billing, council tax, listing uploads, guest manuals, and other key ops tasks.







What We’re Looking For



Meticulous with numbers, records, and deadlines



Confident in Excel — pivot tables, formulas, charts, the works



Comfortable with bookkeeping tools and financial admin software



Communicates clearly and professionally (especially in writing)



Curious, responsible, and proactive — you don’t wait to be told what’s broken



Bonus: experience in property, hospitality, or short-term rentals







Perks & Upside



Remote flexibility



Learn the ins and outs of short-term rental finance



Clear systems, helpful team, and room to grow with us



High-impact role — your work directly supports growth and investor trust



How to Apply



We don’t need a resume. We need to know how you think and how you work.



Start your application with the word “clarity” so we know you’re paying attention

title: Business Support Specialist
description:
Business Support Specialist



Elevate Management, LLC is a professional management consulting firm headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA. We specialize in Vendor Management Services (VMS), Procurement, and Cost Management, along with Program & Project Management, Project Controls, Risk Management, Professional Training, and Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC). We are a Diverse Minority Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB) committed to collaborating with clients in both the private and public sectors, delivering customized solutions that align with their strategic objectives.



We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Business Support Specialist to join our growing team. This is a remote, part-time position with the opportunity to transition to full-time based on performance.



In this role, you will support our business development efforts by researching and identifying potential clients, conducting outreach via
 and LinkedIn, qualifying leads, and maintaining accurate records in our CRM. You will also assist with preparing proposals, bid documents, and presentation materials. As trust is established, responsibilities may expand to include bookkeeping support such as transaction categorization, reconciliations, and financial reporting.



The ideal candidate has excellent written and verbal English communication skills, is comfortable interacting with US-based clients, and thrives in a fast-paced environment where initiative is valued. We are looking for someone with at least 2 years of experience in business development, lead generation, administrative support, or a related field. An accounting degree or background is a plus. Experience with CRM tools, Microsoft Office, and proposal preparation is preferred.



This position starts at 20 hours per week (5 hours per day), with working hours aligned to US Eastern timezone. We begin with a 30-day paid trial, followed by a 90-day probationary period, with the opportunity to extend to full-time if it's a good fit.



If you are a self-starter with strong communication and organizational skills, we'd love to hear from you.



To apply, please submit your resume and a brief introduction about yourself.

title: Data Mining & Web Research Specialist
description:
I am seeking a Data Mining & Web Research Specialist to build a structured dataset based on clearly defined parameters.



This role involves identifying the most relevant online directories and databases within specific niches, extracting targeted data from those sources, and organizing it into clean, well-structured Excel workbooks.



This initial project will serve as a working trial for a longer-term partnership. Strong performance, clear communication, and consistent accuracy will lead to ongoing, similar projects with defined scope and predictable workflow. Accuracy, completeness, and thoughtful organization matter most.



Key Deliverables

• Source Discovery: Research and identify high-quality online directories and databases relevant to the target niches.

• Data Extraction: Use appropriate tools, web scraping methods, or manual research to capture all required data fields.

• Data Structuring: Clean, normalize, and organize the data into two clearly structured Excel workbooks, ready for filtering and analysis.

• Quality Control: Verify accuracy, remove duplicates, and ensure consistency across all entries.



Summary

This is a clearly defined, outcome-driven project with established parameters and no scope creep. You will work from agreed data fields and an aligned technical approach, using tools you are confident in, with accuracy and completeness prioritized over speed. We will maintain a simple communication cadence throughout the project, including a minimum two-hour overlap with CST for periodic check-ins to ensure clarity, efficiency, and alignment from start to finish.

title: Marketing Director
description:
Marketing Director – Workers' Compensation Law Firm (Remote)



Location: Remote | Full-Time | US EST Hours Required







A busy, growing US law firm representing injured workers is seeking a talented, organized, and self-driven Marketing Director to take full ownership of its marketing function. This is not a support role — you will be the marketing department, and we're looking for someone who thrives with that kind of ownership and responsibility.







We have a lot going on. We run Meta ad campaigns, weekly
 marketing, a robust relationship-marketing program that includes handwritten cards, monthly attorney newsletters, quarterly physician outreach, and two annual client events. We also work with an outside digital marketing agency that manages our website and SEO. What we need is someone who can take all of these moving pieces, bring them into a cohesive system, and drive real results.







What You'll Own



Your day-to-day will span a wide range of activities. On the paid digital side, you'll plan, build, and optimize our
 and Instagram ad campaigns to reach injured workers who need legal help. You'll also manage our relationship with our digital marketing agency — reviewing their work, holding them to clear performance benchmarks, and pushing them to deliver better results on our website and search presence.







On the relationship marketing side, you'll manage our KEAP CRM and ensure our weekly
s go out consistently and effectively. You'll oversee our monthly handwritten thank-you and birthday card program, our monthly business-tip letters to referring attorneys, and our quarterly outreach to physicians in our network. These programs are already running but need someone to systematize and elevate them.







You'll also plan and execute two annual events, our Santa Brunch and our Bingo Night, from initial logistics through invitations, execution, and post-event follow-up.







Finally, you'll take the grassroots community campaigns we've been running informally and build them into organized, repeatable efforts with clear goals and tracking.







What We're Looking For



Above all else, you need to be exceptionally organized. This role has many moving parts and many recurring deliverables — if anything slips through the cracks, the whole program suffers. You should be someone who lives by their calendar, builds systems naturally, and follows through without being chased.







Beyond organizational experience, we're looking for hands-on experience with Meta Ads Manager and lead-generation campaigns, ideally in legal, medical, or another consumer-facing industry. You should be comfortable with KEAP or a comparable CRM and
 automation platform. You should have sufficient digital marketing knowledge to have intelligent, challenging conversations with our external agency and to recognize when they're underperforming. Experience managing events, even small ones, is a plus.



Strong written English is essential. You'll be producing content that represents our firm to injured workers, referring attorneys, and physicians, and the tone and quality of that content matter.



Experience in legal marketing is a plus, but not required. What matters more is that you understand B2C lead generation, relationship-based marketing, and what it means to serve people going through difficult times.







What Success Looks Like



In the first 90 days, you'll have audited everything we're doing, built a master marketing calendar, taken over management of all active programs, and launched or relaunched our Meta ad campaigns. Within six months, our agency will be performing better or we'll have made a change, our nurture sequences will be tightened, and we'll have a clear picture of what's driving new clients and what isn't.







Why Join Us



You'll have genuine ownership, a team that respects your expertise, and the resources to do the job well. Our firm has a clear mission: helping people who've been hurt on the job get the representation they deserve, and our marketing should reflect that. We're looking for someone who takes that seriously.



To Apply



Send your resume, a short note describing how you've managed multiple marketing programs simultaneously, and at least one example of a paid social or lead generation campaign you've run. Tell us about a marketing system or process you built from scratch. Applications without these details will not be considered.

title: Shopify Web Designer / Landing Page Builder
description:
About Us



We’re Edition3 x Avalon Studio: Two creative agencies working as one to deliver high-performing, beautifully designed e-commerce experiences. From Shopify builds to conversion-focused landing pages, our work is fast-paced, varied, and always design-led. With new clients joining every month, we’re growing quickly and looking for fresh talent to join our team.



The Role



We’re looking for a Web Designer / Landing Page Builder who’s fluent in both design and build. You’ll design pages in Figma first, using Shopify templates as the framework. This includes creating and polishing assets (banners, graphics, icons) to make every page feel cohesive and on-brand for the client. The ideal candidate has a strong eye for design, understands e-commerce best practices, and is comfortable working on multiple projects at once.



What You’ll Do



- Create page designs in Figma based on Shopify templates.

- Handle asset creation (graphics, banners, icons, basic photo edits).

- Translate client branding and content into polished, conversion-ready designs.

- Ensure every page feels visually sharp, user-friendly, and sales-focused.

- Collaborate with our creative and dev teams to deliver sites on time.

- Keep up with design trends, CRO best practices, and Shopify theme updates.



About You



- Portfolio that shows strong design instincts and web/landing page work.

- Experience designing in Figma and Shopify.

- Familiar with theme customization (bonus if you know HTML, CSS, Liquid).

- Confident in asset creation and adapting brand styles.

- Detail-oriented but efficient. You know how to make things look beautiful without overcomplicating.

- Comfortable working independently in a fast-paced agency environment.

- Strong communicator and team player.



What We Offer



- $9/hour with a minimum of 20 hours per week (big opportunity to grow with us).

- Consistent, varied work across multiple industries.

- A collaborative, creative team where your input is valued.

- Remote flexibility with the pace and excitement of a growing agency.



How to Apply

Send us your portfolio, a quick intro about yourself, and why you’d be a great fit for Edition3 x Avalon Studio.

title: Appointment Setter & Ops Coordinator (Part Time, MST Hours)
description:
Title: Appointment Setter & Onboarding Coordinator (Part-Time, Remote)



Who we are:

We run a performance-focused home remodeling marketing operation. High-ticket projects, fast lead flow, zero fluff. We care about speed, clean comms, and booked shows.



The role:

You will own two critical parts of our operation. First, speed-to-lead. Your primary job is to call new leads in under five minutes, book qualified appointments, run confirmations and reschedules, and keep perfect notes inside our CRM (GoHighLevel). Second, you will act as our Onboarding Coordinator, guiding new clients through the setup process by managing communication and collecting necessary assets. This is not a technical role — our back-end team handles all deep GHL builds. Your focus is on speed, communication, and organization.



What you’ll do:



•Call and text every new lead within five minutes during assigned hours.



•Run a first-hour follow-up cadence and keep touching until a clear yes/no.



•Book qualified leads to the calendar, send confirmation messages immediately, and manage reschedules fast.



•Execute a confirmation routine to protect show rate.



•Maintain clean, searchable notes with outcome, next step, and due time.



•Operate basic CRM settings: place calls, send SMS, move stages, trigger templates, and update contact fields.



•Act as the main point of contact for new clients during onboarding, guiding them through asset collection (e.g., logos, account access) and scheduling their kickoff call.



•End of day: send a short numbers report with attempts, bookings, shows/no-shows, and blockers.



What you’ve ideally done in the past:



•Proven setter or SDR experience handling inbound leads and calendar bookings.



•Consistent speed-to-lead under five minutes during your last role.



•Strong phone presence, clear English, confident pace, and concise objection handling.



•Hands-on with a dialer/CRM (GHL or similar) for daily calling and SMS.



•Track record of maintaining or improving show rates via confirmations and reschedules.



Hours, Pay, and Growth:



•Pay: Starts at $500 USD/month.



•Hours: Part-time, 9am–1pm Mountain Time (20 hours/week) coverage required.



•Growth Path: This role is planned to become full-time (40 hours/week) on April 27th, with a corresponding increase in base pay. This is a long-term position with a clear path for promotion into a Client Success or Operations Management role as the company scales. Performance bonuses will be implemented after a 6-month probation period.



How to apply:

Send one
 with the subject line: “Setter/Ops – I hit five minutes” and include:



1.A 2-minute Loom introducing yourself, your hours, and your last role’s KPIs.



2.Two raw call recordings to fresh inbound leads where you set an appointment.



3.A short Loom screen share in any dialer/CRM showing you place a call, send an SMS, move a stage, log a note properly, and send a booking confirmation.



4.A sample daily report you’ve actually used.



Only applicants who follow these steps will be considered. If you’re reliable, fast, and love turning leads into shows, we want to hear from you!

title: Wholesale Coordinator
description:
Location: Remote 

Reports To: Wholesale Directors

Department: Wholesale



About Chamelo

Chamelo is a celebrity-backed brand growing triple digits. We bootstrapped our way to 8-figures and are about to close a VC round with the goal to accelerate growth toward an IPO.

At Chamelo, we’re engineering a new era of smart eyewear by combining state-of-the-art technology with cutting-edge style. Our mission goes beyond creating dynamic and stylish glasses—we’re pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in a traditionally static industry.

Our eyewear isn’t just functional—it’s bold, customizable, and effortlessly cool. Backed by iconic figures like Shaquille O’Neal and Bad Bunny, Chamelo is on pace for rapid expansion, offering an exciting opportunity to be part of our growth story.



About the Role

We are hiring two highly organized and detail-driven Wholesale Coordinators to support the rapid expansion of Chamelo’s global B2B and retail partnerships.

This role is critical in managing the end-to-end wholesale order lifecycle — from account onboarding and order processing to fulfillment coordination, inventory allocation, and post-delivery support. You will serve as the operational backbone of the wholesale team, ensuring a seamless experience for retail partners while maintaining internal accuracy and efficiency.

The ideal candidates are proactive, data-driven, and thrive in a fast-paced environment where precision, communication, and follow-through are essential.



Key Responsibilities

Wholesale Order Management

Process and manage wholesale purchase orders from receipt to fulfillment.

Validate pricing, SKUs, quantities, payment terms, and shipping requirements.

Coordinate order entry, acknowledgments, and invoice accuracy.

Track order status and provide timely updates to wholesale partners and internal teams.

Account & Partner Support

Assist with onboarding new wholesale accounts, including documentation and system setup.

Serve as a primary point of contact for order-related inquiries and operational requests.

Maintain strong, professional communication with retail buyers and distributors.

Support key accounts to ensure smooth reorders and ongoing partnership growth.

Inventory Allocation & Fulfillment Coordination

Work closely with supply chain and warehouse/3PL partners to allocate inventory for wholesale orders.

Monitor stock availability and communicate potential shortages or delays proactively.

Coordinate shipment scheduling and routing based on partner requirements and delivery windows.

Ensure compliance with retailer routing guides and packaging standards.

Data Management & Reporting

Maintain accurate wholesale data across ERP/CRM/order management systems.

Track wholesale KPIs such as order accuracy, fulfillment timelines, sell-through support, and backorder rates.

Assist in preparing weekly and monthly wholesale performance reports.

Help maintain up-to-date account records, price lists, and line sheets.

Cross-Team Collaboration

Partner with Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, and Customer Experience to ensure seamless execution.

Support product launches, seasonal buys, and promotional campaigns from an operational perspective.

Assist with trade shows, market appointments, and sample coordination as needed.

Contribute to building and improving scalable wholesale SOPs and workflows.



Qualifications

Strong organizational and time management skills with exceptional attention to detail.

Experience in wholesale, B2B sales support, order management, or supply chain coordination, preferably in ecommerce or consumer goods.

Proficiency with ERP/CRM systems, inventory tools, and Google Workspace/Microsoft Office.

Ability to manage multiple accounts and orders simultaneously in a deadline-driven environment.

Clear and professional written and verbal communication.

Solution-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Experience working with global retail partners, distributors, or 3PLs is a strong advantage.



What We Offer

Competitive above-market salary.

Paid time off and paid holidays.

13th month pay.

Regular performance bonus.

Annual salary bonus/increases based on performance.

Remote-friendly work environment.

Fun and collaborative culture with team contests.



Application Process

Please send your resume and answers to the following questions to 

Subject Line: “Wholesale Operator!”

Application Questions

If you could be one famous entrepreneur (alive or dead), who would you be and why?

One paragraph (5 sentences max) on any relevant experience you have.

Your favorite productivity hack.

What are your key strengths?

What are your weaknesses?

Your desired number of weekly hours & desired start date.

Your availability next week for a quick chat.

Equal Opportunity

Chamelo is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: FUNNEL BUILDER (Part-time)
description:
We’re hiring a Funnel Builder who knows how to architect, build, and optimize conversion-focused funnels using GoHighLevel and automation tools like 
 and Zapier.



This role is for someone who thinks in systems, understands how cold traffic behaves, and builds funnels cleanly and correctly. You are here to design, deploy, and improve funnels.  Your priorities are CRO, reliable automation, and creating a magical client experience from the first time someone interacts with our brand.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Team Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important, and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just managing marketing campaigns for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you think like a funnel and conversion architect? Do you enjoy structuring systems, workflows, and sales psychology that drives measurable results? Are you obsessed with improving KPIs by designing experiments and running tests? Do you take pride in building things properly the first time while still iterating and optimizing?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Funnel Architecture, Buildout & Optimization

- Build complete funnels inside GoHighLevel focused on lead generation

- Structure landing pages with conversion principles in mind

- Create and customize pages, forms, and
s

- Embed forms, manage page layouts, and ensure clean user flow across multiple devices

- Maintain proper tagging architecture and funnel logic



Automations, Workflows & Integrations

- Build and maintain workflows, automations, and multi-step sequences

- Implement conditional logic and clean tag-based systems

- Create 
 automations as needed

- Integrate APIs and third-party tools where required (OPTIONAL, but preferred)

- Set up UTM parameters, tracking codes, and verify traffic source links are set up correctly



Tracking, Optimization & Testing

- Implement Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager (bonus)

- Ensure accurate tracking and data flow across funnels

- Apply an A/B testing mindset to improve conversion rates

- Optimize funnels over time based on performance data and KPIs



Campaign Systems & Deployment

- Maintain clean, scalable campaign structures

- Collaborate with leadership on funnel improvements and testing plans

- Continuously learn and stay up to date on best practices to help brainstorm and make recommendations for improvements to our funnel ecosystem



Requirements:

- STRONG hands-on experience with GoHighLevel, required

- Recent experience with workflows, automations, tags, and sequences, required

- Experience building lead generation funnels (not ecom or dropshipping focused), required

- Experience with 
 and/or Zapier automations, required

- Understanding of conversion rate optimization and buyer behavior, required

- Ability to think in systems and campaign logic, required

- Clean build habits, required

- Moderate familiarity with cold traffic funnels, required

- Strong English communication skills; near-native preferred if involved in testing copy

- Interest in copy, funnel strategy, and optimization (execution-focused)

- A stable, high-speed internet connection, required (at least 150mbps)

- Growth mindset, required



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

- Meta Ads, Google Ads, or media buying familiarity

- Meta Pixel, GA4, GTM setup experience

- Basic SEO understanding

- API integrations beyond native tools



NOTE: This is a part-time role (5–15 hrs/week) with the opportunity to grow into a full-time position for the right person.



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.



As part of your application, include a Loom or YouTube video (2 minutes or less) explaining why you believe you’re a strong fit for this specific Funnel Builder role.







STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to an interview.



STEP 3:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 4:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Funnel Builder with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Motion Designer. Short Form SaaS/B2B. AI Rebuild and Finish Required
description:
Motion Designer. Short Form SaaS/B2B. AI Rebuild and Finish Required



Pay

10 to 16 USD per hour, depending on skill and proof of work



Trial

2 weeks. 10 hours per week. Paid.



Long-term

If you pass the trial and stay consistent. 20+ per week.



MoveUp Studio

We make complex B2B clear. We work with a small set of SaaS and B2B teams who care about craft.



The role

You own our short-form motion output. You take messy bullets and turn them into calm, premium posts. Great type. Tight pacing. Zero noise.

Taste matters. If it feels generic, we iterate until it feels designed.



Explainers

You will support our complex videos with scene builds, cutdowns, and motion execution.



AI. Required

AI is required. You do not need to use it on every task, but you must be strong with it.

You must be able to rebuild AI starts into clean layered or vector assets, then animate them with taste.

If AI is used, we require the source file or project link, the settings used, and the rebuilt files.

No third-party brands, UIs, or likeness inputs unless we have explicit permission.

If you use tools outside Adobe, you must show the plan level that grants commercial use for that asset.



Bonus: Strong with AI video generation tools, as long as you can still deliver control, clean files, and commercially safe usage.



What you do

Short-form posts from rough inputs

Hook variations and cutdowns

Reusable components

Clean files. Strict naming. Clean versioning



Work log

We pay hourly. Payments are fortnightly.

Each work block includes start and end times, what shipped, a preview link, and the working files link.

Naming rule: Client. PostName. v01. YYYYMMDD.



Not a fit

Ideas feel generic

Not strong with AI workflows

Missed deadlines

Messy files or missing sources

Time logs do not match outputs

Needs constant direction

Style drifts into noise



How we work

Async first

One review call per week max

Daily update with a preview link

We are direct, we move fast, and we care about the work.



Apply

Short note. Why this role

Portfolio or reel

2 short-form examples

1 AI rebuild example

Required: Include a 60-second screen recording showing the AI source, your rebuild into layered or vector files, and the final motion piece

title: Senior GoHighLevel Architect (Tattoo Studios & Events Group)
description:
Remote | Full-Time Project (Potential Ongoing Role)



Who We Are

We operate a fast-growing U.S.-based group of companies in the tattoo industry, including:

Multi-location tattoo studios

A large tattoo convention brand

An aftercare product company



We run paid ads across Meta & Google, generate thousands of leads per month, and are aggressively scaling into new locations.



We are now building a centralized GoHighLevel infrastructure to become the backbone of our entire organization.



This is not a small project. We want someone who can architect and build this correctly from day one.



The Mission

Build and fully optimize our GoHighLevel system across:

 Tattoo Studio Locations (first phase)

 Convention Brand (second phase)

 Artist Recruitment Funnel (third phase)

 Aftercare Brand (fourth phase)

We will be using the Unlimited subaccount version, with each location and company siloed properly.

This will include full CRM architecture, automation, reporting, SMS/email systems, call tracking, and ad integration.



Scope of Work



CRM & Subaccount Architecture:

Structure multiple subaccounts correctly

Build pipelines for each studio location

Create proper tagging systems

Set up user permissions for location staff

Design scalable infrastructure for future locations



Lead Capture & Automation:

Website form integration

Meta Ads integration

Google Ads integration

Call tracking + missed-call text back

Walk-in tagging system

Automated follow-up sequences

Rebooking automations

Review request systems

Nurture campaigns

SMS &
 workflows



Funnels & Campaigns:

Tattoo booking funnel

Artist recruitment funnel

Convention vendor funnel

Newsletter system (may replace Mailchimp)



Reporting & Dashboards:

Cost per lead

Lead-to-book rate

Show rate

Revenue tracking per location

Performance dashboards for leadership



System Setup:

Phone numbers within GHL

Reputation management

Calendar setup

Proper automation testing

Documentation of system architecture





What We’re Looking For

You are not just a “GHL user.”

You are a systems thinker.



You:

Have built multi-location GHL setups before

Understand attribution and reporting deeply

Know how to reduce lead leakage

Think in terms of conversion rates

Build scalable automation systems

Know SMS compliance rules

Can confidently integrate Meta & Google Ads



You should be able to:

Audit an existing account

Propose improvements

Architect from scratch

Build clean workflows

Document everything clearly



What Success Looks Like (90 Days):

Every location has a clean pipeline

No leads go unfollowed

Missed calls trigger auto-text

Rebooking reminders active

Review requests automated

Marketing dashboard live

Leadership can see performance metrics weekly

System built to scale for new locations easily



Growth Opportunity

This starts as a project role.

If executed well, this may become:

Ongoing GHL system manager

Automation lead

Long-term strategic operations role



We are expanding into additional locations and brands.

There will be no shortage of systems to build.



To Apply Send:



A message explaining:

A multi-location GHL setup you built

How you structure pipelines

How you prevent lead leakage



A short written answer:

What are the 3 biggest mistakes businesses make when setting up GoHighLevel?

Your availability.



Important

We are not looking for:

Someone learning GHL

Someone who needs step-by-step instructions

Someone who builds messy automations



We want someone who can own this system.



If you are a serious GoHighLevel architect and want to build something large and scalable, we want to talk.

title: Trading Chart Research & Sync Editor (Content VA) – Remote
description:
Hello — hope you’re doing well!

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



This is a long-term collaborative opportunity for editors who value consistency, creativity, and growth alongside a dedicated team.

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



We run a high-quality trading education channel and are looking for a resourceful, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant who can listen to a narrated voiceover, understand the trading concepts being explained, and find (or recreate) charts that perfectly match each segment.



This position blends chart literacy with creative problem-solving — you’ll often need to recognize what’s being discussed even when the term isn’t explicitly stated, and then source or recreate the right chart to visually communicate the concept to viewers.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Responsibilities

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Listen closely to the provided clip and tell the story through accurate, well-timed chart visuals.



Understand the trading term, setup, or market condition being discussed.



Locate, screenshot, or recreate high-quality trading charts that match the narration.



Add relevant effects, transitions, and annotations using Camtasia to enhance storytelling and maintain viewer engagement.



Verify each chart shows the correct instrument, timeframe, and clarity.



Organize and deliver charts in sequence for the video editor to sync.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Requirements

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Strong understanding of core trading concepts (support/resistance, indicators, market structure, patterns, liquidity grabs, etc.).



Ability to deduce and identify setups even when implied in narration.



Hands-on experience with TradingView or similar charting platforms.



Resourceful and precise — able to find the best visual representation, not just the easiest one.



Exceptional attention to detail, timing, and visual storytelling.





________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Platform Requirement

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Camtasia is required for the entire project.



You will be provided with all effects, transitions, and other tools needed to complete the work through our Camtasia Library package.



All work must be created, edited, and exported through Camtasia, ensuring all effects, transitions, and assets are properly embedded in the Camtasia Library Package (.libzip) format.



You may use the free version — a paid license is not required.



Ensure your system can run Camtasia smoothly and handle exporting without lag or crashes.





________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Training & Brand Style

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Full training provided on our chart color codes, formatting, and visual standards.



Access to visual templates to ensure consistency across all videos.



The goal: maintain a clean, professional, and uniform chart style that aligns with our brand identity.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Nice to Have

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Previous experience in trading or finance-related content creation.



Familiarity with educational or YouTube-based video production workflows.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Workload & Pay

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



1 video per month (8–12 minutes each)



(Includes a 1-minute clip workflow to maintain consistency and quality across projects.)



Pay Range: $70 – $150+ per video



Based on:



- Skill level



- Creativity



- Accuracy



- Execution quality



- Turnaround time



- Effort level



The link below showcases the work produced by editors on the team. All of the edits are strong, but each one reflects a different level of dedication, detail, and overall quality — and that’s exactly why we use an incentive-based system. 



The harder you work, and the more accurately and creatively you execute the story using chart visuals and our effects library, the more you earn.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Flexible schedule — because we view editors as partners, you’re trusted to manage your own time, work efficiently, and find the pace that suits you best while still delivering within a reasonable timeframe.



________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



How to Apply

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Include the word “RSI” at the top of your application to confirm you’ve read this description.

In your message, please share:



Your experience with trading and charting platforms.



Any examples or samples of your past trading visuals or chart work.



If you have any questions at all , don’t hesitate to ask — we value clear communication and collaboration. 



Thank you for your time.

title: Admin Coordinator
description:
Company Information

Seismic Talent Agency is an independent music booking agency based in Sydney, AUS who handles the touring commitments for our artist roster throughout the Asia-Pacific region. We work with globally recognized clients such as Alison Wonderland, Example, The Presets, Miami Horror, Tigerlily, Lance Savali, Young Franco and more.



About the Role

We’re recruiting for an enthusiastic and efficient Artist Admin Coordinator (VA) to manage the administrative and data-entry duties of our company. In this entry-level role, you will be reporting to our Senior Artist Admin Coordinator, but liaising with multiple contacts within the company. This role requires a high level of attention-to-detail, as such, please go to 
/free-aptitude-test/clerical-ability and complete their attention to detail test. Include a screenshot of your results in your application
.



Key duties and responsibilities

Key responsibilities will be handling the administrative and data-entry elements of our business, this includes tasks such as:

title: Skilled Social Media video editor for coach
description:
Video Editor for Personal Brand Coaching Content

(Clean, Premium, Story-Driven Style)



++++Please read the whole description carefully++++



After reading this, please only message me with:



• Your edited trial reel useing this footage 
/file/d/12IhNBjYG7cIo01jWAWhLo_D9MycJMUTO/view?usp=sharing

• A short note about you and why you’d be a strong fit

• Your monthly rate



Keep it concise and intentional.



I’m a mindset and performance coach creating short-form video content for Instagram (Reels), TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.



I’m looking for a long-term editor who understands clean, subtle editing and knows how to support the message rather than overpower it.





What I Need



• 20 to 30 short-form videos per month

• 30 to 60 seconds each

• Strong hooks in the first 1–2 seconds

• Retention-focused pacing

• Organized workflow

• Fast turnaround



What I Will Provide



• Raw talking-head footage

• Occasional B-roll folders (walking shots, podcast clips, etc.)

• Clear direction on hook and message



Editing Style I Want



• Clean and minimal

• Premium feel

• Music that supports pacing but never overpowers the voice

• Subtle zoom cuts to maintain energy

• Simple captions (white or neutral tones, no bright colors)

• Strong visual rhythm

• Thoughtful storytelling through the edit



The edit should enhance clarity and emotional impact, not distract from the message.



What I Do NOT Want



• Overly trendy TikTok-style edits

• Excessive motion graphics

• 
-style inserts

• Distracting subtitles

• Heavy visual effects

• Random stock footage that feels generic

• “Over-edited” AI-looking visuals



This is premium coaching content. It should feel confident, sharp, and intentional.



Trial Edit Requirement



To ensure this is a strong fit, I’ve attached a sample clip.



You do not need to edit the full video.

Please send back a 15–30 second cut that demonstrates:



• A strong hook

• Clean pacing

• Premium storytelling

• How you incorporate Oprah Winfrey (photo or video) over my footage

• Your caption style

• Your overall editing approach



I’m looking for editors who not only execute well, but also bring ideas.

If you have creative instincts around structure, rhythm, or format development, that’s a plus. I want someone who wants to grow as the brand grows.



Compensation



Please include your monthly rate for 20–30 videos when submitting your trial reel.



I’m looking for someone long-term who wants to build something recognizable and evolve the content over time.

title: Visual Marketing Designer (Funnels + Graphics)
description:
Virtualee & Co is an online business management agency that empowers stuck and overwhelmed Coaches & Founders to scale their business & reclaim their time. And our all-female wonders team is looking for you!



We’re looking for a Visual Marketing Designer (Funnels + Graphics) who thrives on details, creativity, strategy, and results. You’ll be responsible for designing high-converting marketing funnels and crafting visuals that are both stunning and strategic. If you're a visual storyteller who’s obsessed with user experience and knows how to turn ideas into eye-catching designs that drive action—we want to meet you.



Key Responsibilities:



Funnel Design Mastery: Strategize, design and optimize end-to-end marketing funnels, ensuring a seamless and visually appealing user journey. Collaborating with the team to align funnel designs with campaign objectives.



Visual Storytelling: Create captivating graphics, illustrations, and visual elements to tell compelling brand and product or service stories. Develop a cohesive visual identity that resonates with our target audience.



Creative Precision: Bring strong attention to detail, a keen sense of aesthetics, and creative thinking to every project from layout to final approvals.



Conversion Optimization: Brainstorm, suggest, and implement design strategies to enhance conversion rates at every stage of the funnel. Must also be able to monitor results and bring light to highest performing variables for optimization.



Responsive Design: Ensure all funnel elements are optimized for various devices, providing a seamless experience across desktop, tablet, and mobile.



Collaboration and Iteration: Embrace feedback and iterate on designs to continuously improve performance.



Stay Ahead of Design Trends: Keep a pulse on the latest design trends, techniques, and tools in the digital marketing space, including social media. Implement innovative and fresh design elements to stay ahead of the competition. Continuously expand your knowledge of sales funnel design and digital marketing strategies.



Qualifications:



Proven experience in strategizing and designing marketing funnels with a focus on conversion optimization.

Proficiency in graphic design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva).

Strong understanding of user experience (UX) principles and responsive design.

Proficiency in funnel-building or website platforms (e.g., ClickFunnels, Kajabi, WordPress, Leadpages) is a strong plus.

A creative thinker with strong attention to detail and a keen sense of aesthetics



Preferred Skills:



Familiarity with marketing automation platforms and CRM systems.

Ability to translate complex concepts into visually appealing and easy-to-understand graphics.

Strong project management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.



Please send us your most updated CV and portfolio when you apply.
